revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-12 01:34:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_imagebackend.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': "Check QCOW2 image size during root disk creation

size of the QCOW2. As such we need to check the virtual size of

Change-Id: I833467284126557eb598b8350a84e10c06292fa9
Fixes: bug 1177830
(cherry picked from commit 44a8aba1d5da87d54db48079103fdef946666d80)

commit_message:
Check QCOW2 image size during root disk creation

glance can only tell us the size of the file, not the virtual
size of the QCOW2. As such we need to check the virtual size of
the image once its cached and ensure it's <= to the flavor's
root disk size.

Change-Id: I833467284126557eb598b8350a84e10c06292fa9
Fixes: bug 1177830
(cherry picked from commit 44a8aba1d5da87d54db48079103fdef946666d80)

subject: Enable unicode error message
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-14 14:53:59.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_exception.py', 'keystone/exception.py'], 'message': 'Enable unicode error message

Keystone exceptions could only take byte string message as the
message arguments to construct exception instances because of
the way its super class StandardError implements __unicode__.
This patch can also make sure it would not unintentionally remove
line breaks and indentation in a explicitly given message argument.

Fixs bug #1168879

Change-Id: I7916efc87845cfc4dba705e9474125b275affc13
'}]
commit_message:
Enable unicode error message

Keystone exceptions could only take byte string message as the
message arguments to construct exception instances because of
the way its super class StandardError implements __unicode__.
This patch can also make sure it would not unintentionally remove
line breaks and indentation in a explicitly given message argument.

Fixs bug #1168879

Change-Id: I7916efc87845cfc4dba705e9474125b275affc13

commit_message:
Change Daemon class to better match process command lines.

Add additional uuid argument Daemon class to help it better
match output from /proc/$id/cmdline to the correct daemon.
If there is a stale pid in the pidfile, and that process has
the same name, then it could match accidentally and not
start the daemon up properly.

Fixes bug 1177416

Change-Id: I1109ca73c539c5e96cbe3dbb55ce68c92013ee10
(cherry picked from commit 6db5b0b77d0dd8b0f5010a71c769a821881797c5)

subject: Fix 500 raised on disassociate_floatingips when out of sync
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-13 21:49:31.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/plugins/nicira/nicira_nvp_plugin/QuantumPlugin.py'], 'message': 'Fix 500 raised on disassociate_floatingips when out of sync

If one deletes NAT rules directly from NVP and not through quantum,
an error will be raised when deleting a port that is associated with
the floating ip. This patch catches the NotFound exception and logs
it so that the port can successfully be deleted.

Fixes bug: 1177176

Change-Id: Ia7d0b94957d0c6b014d242439245b0e4fa9de40d
(cherry picked from commit 17336b9cb64048652bb6853fe0429699b4762a40)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix 500 raised on disassociate_floatingips when out of sync

If one deletes NAT rules directly from NVP and not through quantum,
an error will be raised when deleting a port that is associated with
the floating ip. This patch catches the NotFound exception and logs
it so that the port can successfully be deleted.

Fixes bug: 1177176

Change-Id: Ia7d0b94957d0c6b014d242439245b0e4fa9de40d
(cherry picked from commit 17336b9cb64048652bb6853fe0429699b4762a40)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-13 12:27:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/driver.py'], 'message': 'Show the cause of virt driver error

Make sure that the virt driver loading errors are shown with the
stacktrace attached. Otherwise the source of an import error can be
completely hidden. This is important here, since virt driver can fail
due to various issues, like quantum vif problem.

Change-Id: Icb90d348e4a4ddef5768ca32836bd95d94981499
'}]
commit_message:
Show the cause of virt driver error

Make sure that the virt driver loading errors are shown with the
stacktrace attached. Otherwise the source of an import error can be
completely hidden. This is important here, since virt driver can fail
due to various issues, like quantum vif problem.

Change-Id: Icb90d348e4a4ddef5768ca32836bd95d94981499

commit_message:
Renames filter to base_filter and weight to base_weight

filter is a python builtin function so importing it pollutes ones name
space.

It is now renamed to base_filter.

We also rename weight to base_weight, just to be consistent in the
naming conventions.

We add a test for base_filter.

Fixes bug 1175829

Change-Id: I46e0fa696d2f39081b5568c701b0a70c54f271ab

subject: Only search the lib dir for rpc_backend
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-05-13 17:35:44.000000000', 'files': ['lib/rpc_backend'], 'message': 'Only search the lib dir for rpc_backend

The grep in rpc_backend uses . to search all files. Unfortunately
the current directory when the command is called is not the lib
directory, so change it to search the lib directory instead.
Without this fix the command is forced to grep all files under
devstack which could be very slow if one has downloaded large
images.

Fixes bug 1174718

Change-Id: Ic8a59885cd07e5d6f2e734e80824762f9ac12996
'}]
commit_message:
Only search the lib dir for rpc_backend

The grep in rpc_backend uses . to search all files. Unfortunately
the current directory when the command is called is not the lib
directory, so change it to search the lib directory instead.
Without this fix the command is forced to grep all files under
devstack which could be very slow if one has downloaded large
images.

Fixes bug 1174718

Change-Id: Ic8a59885cd07e5d6f2e734e80824762f9ac12996

subject: Fix obscure double url bug in container quota middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-05-13 19:17:33.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/container_quotas.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_quotas.py'], 'message': "Fix obscure double url bug in container quota middleware

With the container quota middleware on, if you made a request similar to the
following one you'd get a 500 response.

curl -i -X PUT -H 'X-Auth-Token: token'
http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/AUTH_testhttp://something/something_else

(Note the double url.)

This was due to a mismatch in how split_path() was called in the middleware and
in the get_container_info().

This change fixes that mismatch and the bug.

Change-Id: Ie42ab585b942b7201e13b02a0c706532952aac60
"}]
commit_message:
Fix obscure double url bug in container quota middleware

With the container quota middleware on, if you made a request similar to the
following one you'd get a 500 response.

curl -i -X PUT -H 'X-Auth-Token: token'
http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/AUTH_testhttp://something/something_else

(Note the double url.)

This was due to a mismatch in how split_path() was called in the middleware and
in the get_container_info().

This change fixes that mismatch and the bug.

Change-Id: Ie42ab585b942b7201e13b02a0c706532952aac60

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-13 20:15:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/rpc/impl_qpid.py'], 'message': "python3: use 'as' syntax for exception assignment

From http://docs.python.org/3.1/whatsnew/3.0.html

The except exc as var syntax is now standard and except exc,
var is no longer supported.

Change-Id: Ia3a11d72c474806cc2303a7fc9cb1a390266c0fb

commit_message:
python3: use 'as' syntax for exception assignment

From http://docs.python.org/3.1/whatsnew/3.0.html

The except exc as var syntax is now standard and except exc,
var is no longer supported.

Change-Id: Ia3a11d72c474806cc2303a7fc9cb1a390266c0fb
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

subject: Implement the SubnetId property in the Instance resource
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-05-10 15:01:53.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_vpc.py', 'heat/engine/resources/network_interface.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance.py', 'heat/engine/resources/instance.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance_network.py'], 'message': 'Implement the SubnetId property in the Instance resource

If the SubnetId parameter is given in the template, the handle_create method
in the Instance resource verifies the subnet in quantum and configures the
NetworkInterfaces for the subnet. If no NetworkInterface is specified, a port
is created for the subnet and the nic is configured to use that port.

Change-Id: I5a05cbe0798e6b181bf9dd3b547cda525e18480f
Fixes: bug #1163952
'}]
commit_message:
Implement the SubnetId property in the Instance resource

If the SubnetId parameter is given in the template, the handle_create method
in the Instance resource verifies the subnet in quantum and configures the
NetworkInterfaces for the subnet. If no NetworkInterface is specified, a port
is created for the subnet and the nic is configured to use that port.

Change-Id: I5a05cbe0798e6b181bf9dd3b547cda525e18480f
Fixes: bug #1163952

subject: Enhance log msg to report referer and user-agent
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 917, 'name': 'Chuck Thier', 'email': 'cthier@gmail.com', 'username': 'cthier'}, {'_account_id': 1216, 'name': 'gholt', 'email': 'z-launchpad@brim.net', 'username': 'gholt'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 2696, 'name': 'Darrell Bishop', 'email': 'dbishop@nvidia.com', 'username': 'darrellb'}, {'_account_id': 6198, 'name': 'Peter Portante', 'email': 'peter.a.portante@gmail.com', 'username': 'peter-a-portante'}, {'_account_id': 7119, 'name': 'Mohammed Junaid', 'email': 'junaid@redhat.com', 'username': 'mdjunaid.54'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2013-05-09 01:34:52.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py', 'swift/common/middleware/tempurl.py', 'test/unit/common/test_direct_client.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'test/unit/container/test_server.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_except.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'swift/obj/replicator.py', 'swift/obj/updater.py', 'swift/container/server.py', 'swift/container/updater.py', 'swift/common/direct_client.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempurl.py', 'swift/common/swob.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/account.py', 'swift/common/middleware/catch_errors.py', 'test/unit/common/test_swob.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/container.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': 'Enhance log msg to report referer and user-agent

Enhance internally logged messages to report referer and user-agent.

Pass the referering URL and METHOD between internal servers (when
known), and set the user-agent to be the server type (obj-server,
container-server, proxy-server, obj-updater, obj-replicator,
container-updater, direct-client, etc.) with the process PID. In
conjunction with the transaction ID, it helps to track down which PID
from a given system was responsible for initiating the request and
what that server was working on to make this request.

This has been helpful in tracking down interactions between object,
container and account servers.

We also take things a bit further performaing a bit of refactoring to
consolidate calls to transfer_headers() now that we have a helper
method for constructing them.

Finally we performed further changes to avoid header key duplication
due to string literal header key values and the various objects
representing headers for requests and responses. See below for more
details.

====

Header Keys

There seems to be a bit of a problem with the case of the various
string literals used for header keys and the interchangable way
standard Python dictionaries, HeaderKeyDict() and HeaderEnvironProxy()
objects are used.

If one is not careful, a header object of some sort (one that does not
normalize its keys, and that is not necessarily a dictionary) can be
constructed containing header keys which differ only by the case of
their string literals. E.g.:

   { 'x-trans-id': '1234', 'X-Trans-Id': '5678' }

Such an object, when passed to http_connect() will result in an
on-the-wire header where the key values are merged together, comma
separated, that looks something like:

   HTTP_X_TRANS_ID: 1234,5678

For some headers in some contexts, this is behavior is desirable. For
example, one can also use a list of tuples which enumerate the multiple
values a single header should have.

However, in almost all of the contexts used in the code base, this is
not desirable.

This behavior arises from a combination of factors:

   1. Header strings are not constants and different lower-case and
      title-case header strings values are used interchangably in the
      code at times

      It might be worth the effort to make a pass through the code to
      stop using string literals and use constants instead, but there
      are plusses and minuses to doing that, so this was not attempted
      in this effort

   2. HeaderEnvironProxy() objects report their keys in ".title()"
      case, but normalize all other key references to the form
      expected by the Request class's environ field

      swob.Request.headers fields are HeaderEnvironProxy() objects.

   3. HeaderKeyDict() objects report their keys in ".lower()" case,
      and normalize all other key references to ".lower()" case

      swob.Response.headers fields are HeaderKeyDict() objects.

Depending on which object is used and how it is used, one can end up
with such a mismatch.

This commit takes the following steps as a (PROPOSED) solution:

   1. Change HeaderKeyDict() to normalize using ".title()" case to
      match HeaderEnvironProxy()

   2. Replace standard python dictionary objects with HeaderKeyDict()
      objects where possible

      This gives us an object that normalizes key references to avoid
      fixing the code to normalize the string literals.

   3. Fix up a few places to use title case string literals to match
      the new defaults

Change-Id: Ied56a1df83ffac793ee85e796424d7d20f18f469
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Enhance log msg to report referer and user-agent

Enhance internally logged messages to report referer and user-agent.

Pass the referering URL and METHOD between internal servers (when
known), and set the user-agent to be the server type (obj-server,
container-server, proxy-server, obj-updater, obj-replicator,
container-updater, direct-client, etc.) with the process PID. In
conjunction with the transaction ID, it helps to track down which PID
from a given system was responsible for initiating the request and
what that server was working on to make this request.

This has been helpful in tracking down interactions between object,
container and account servers.

We also take things a bit further performaing a bit of refactoring to
consolidate calls to transfer_headers() now that we have a helper
method for constructing them.

Finally we performed further changes to avoid header key duplication
due to string literal header key values and the various objects
representing headers for requests and responses. See below for more
details.

====

Header Keys

There seems to be a bit of a problem with the case of the various
string literals used for header keys and the interchangable way
standard Python dictionaries, HeaderKeyDict() and HeaderEnvironProxy()
objects are used.

If one is not careful, a header object of some sort (one that does not
normalize its keys, and that is not necessarily a dictionary) can be
constructed containing header keys which differ only by the case of
their string literals. E.g.:

   { 'x-trans-id': '1234', 'X-Trans-Id': '5678' }

Such an object, when passed to http_connect() will result in an
on-the-wire header where the key values are merged together, comma
separated, that looks something like:

   HTTP_X_TRANS_ID: 1234,5678

For some headers in some contexts, this is behavior is desirable. For
example, one can also use a list of tuples which enumerate the multiple
values a single header should have.

However, in almost all of the contexts used in the code base, this is
not desirable.

This behavior arises from a combination of factors:

   1. Header strings are not constants and different lower-case and
      title-case header strings values are used interchangably in the
      code at times

      It might be worth the effort to make a pass through the code to
      stop using string literals and use constants instead, but there
      are plusses and minuses to doing that, so this was not attempted
      in this effort

   2. HeaderEnvironProxy() objects report their keys in ".title()"
      case, but normalize all other key references to the form
      expected by the Request class's environ field

      swob.Request.headers fields are HeaderEnvironProxy() objects.

   3. HeaderKeyDict() objects report their keys in ".lower()" case,
      and normalize all other key references to ".lower()" case

      swob.Response.headers fields are HeaderKeyDict() objects.

Depending on which object is used and how it is used, one can end up
with such a mismatch.

This commit takes the following steps as a (PROPOSED) solution:

   1. Change HeaderKeyDict() to normalize using ".title()" case to
      match HeaderEnvironProxy()

   2. Replace standard python dictionary objects with HeaderKeyDict()
      objects where possible

      This gives us an object that normalizes key references to avoid
      fixing the code to normalize the string literals.

   3. Fix up a few places to use title case string literals to match
      the new defaults

Change-Id: Ied56a1df83ffac793ee85e796424d7d20f18f469
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Convert to using newly imported processutils.

This change moves nova over to using the newly imported trycmd() and
ssh_execute() implementations from oslo's processutils.

Change-Id: Ied2bb1eeb0cbdc6903a4028a60c89ca9e23656b4

subject: Remove duplicate gettext.install() calls
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-08 10:42:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cmd/dhcpbridge.py', 'nova/cmd/clear_rabbit_queues.py', 'nova/cmd/scheduler.py', 'nova/cmd/baremetal_manage.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': "Remove duplicate gettext.install() calls

When commit 799a925 moved us to console scripts entry points, we moved
the gettext.install() call into nova/cmd/__init__.py but forgot to
remove it from some of the commands.

Since that move, we've switched to using gettextutils.install() which
supports a $NOVA_LOCALEDIR environment variable ... so calling install()
from these commands will actually break that support.

Change-Id: I1f959704551b35e95c5470a7aef900312db2e223
"}]
commit_message:
Remove duplicate gettext.install() calls

When commit 799a925 moved us to console scripts entry points, we moved
the gettext.install() call into nova/cmd/__init__.py but forgot to
remove it from some of the commands.

Since that move, we've switched to using gettextutils.install() which
supports a $NOVA_LOCALEDIR environment variable ... so calling install()
from these commands will actually break that support.

Change-Id: I1f959704551b35e95c5470a7aef900312db2e223

commit_message:
Include `openstack.common.setup` from Oslo

`openstack.common.version` includes a dependency on `openstack.common.setup`
that wasn't captured by Nova's `openstack-common.conf`. This patch adds that
line to the conf and copies the file into the repo.

Fixes bug 1178743

Change-Id: I85c427459042592a2e788793cf6fd851e5182897

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-05-13 17:56:17.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create', 'lib/img-defaults', 'sudoers.d/img-build-sudoers'], 'message': 'Honor $DIB_IMAGE_SIZE.

The recent change to use loopdev instead of nbd stopped
honoring the DIB_IMAGE_SIZE setting.

This change adds it back, by resizing the image to
DIB_IMAGE_SIZE GB, if specified. If unspecified, it resizes
the image to (actual usage + 20%), as it did before this change.

Change-Id: I69afd9584e644ddacc948619100f153d3d8713a4
'}]
commit_message:
Honor $DIB_IMAGE_SIZE.

The recent change to use loopdev instead of nbd stopped
honoring the DIB_IMAGE_SIZE setting.

This change adds it back, by resizing the image to
DIB_IMAGE_SIZE GB, if specified. If unspecified, it resizes
the image to (actual usage + 20%), as it did before this change.

Change-Id: I69afd9584e644ddacc948619100f153d3d8713a4

subject: Nova evacuate failed when VM is in SHUTOFF status
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-07 16:56:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Nova evacuate failed when VM is in SHUTOFF status

When the VM is in SHUTOFF status and the original compute host is
down, issue the "nova evacuate" command to rebuild the VM on
another host, it is failed due to a type error: string indices
must be integers.

Fix bug 1176773
Change-Id: I76ebce6882198365717167f29a484e4ec994db0c
(cherry picked from commit 2c1bd79a202c868bfeee7ca92e817ad19ef06b76)
'}]
commit_message:
Nova evacuate failed when VM is in SHUTOFF status

When the VM is in SHUTOFF status and the original compute host is
down, issue the "nova evacuate" command to rebuild the VM on
another host, it is failed due to a type error: string indices
must be integers.

Fix bug 1176773
Change-Id: I76ebce6882198365717167f29a484e4ec994db0c
(cherry picked from commit 2c1bd79a202c868bfeee7ca92e817ad19ef06b76)

commit_message:
api : Fix template-show partial URL redirect

All other API actions will provide a redirect if you only provide the
stack ID or name (rather than both), the template URL currently doesn't
because the template subpath is missing from the mapper lookup

Fixes bug #1178705

Change-Id: Ib8e8dd7691bc48587c9d91e937ac2c2c35ac3ce6

subject: engine : rename check_active to make it more generic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-13 13:49:28.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_metadata_refresh.py', 'heat/engine/resources/autoscaling.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance.py', 'heat/tests/test_autoscaling.py', 'heat/engine/resources/instance.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance_group.py'], 'message': 'engine : rename check_active to make it more generic

Rename check_active to check_create_complete, since "active" is
really a detail of Instance state, and so it seems wrong for other
resources which take a long time to create but are not Instance
based (e.g WaitConditions).  This change will also allow us to
align other stack "state check" functions with the state we're
checking for in a consistent way (e.g check_delete_complete etc)

Fixes bug #1178591

Change-Id: I55a824e6ba3de87cedd0b844e7f4e1294917533a
'}]
commit_message:
engine : rename check_active to make it more generic

Rename check_active to check_create_complete, since "active" is
really a detail of Instance state, and so it seems wrong for other
resources which take a long time to create but are not Instance
based (e.g WaitConditions).  This change will also allow us to
align other stack "state check" functions with the state we're
checking for in a consistent way (e.g check_delete_complete etc)

Fixes bug #1178591

Change-Id: I55a824e6ba3de87cedd0b844e7f4e1294917533a

subject: Use metadata from volume on instance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-13 15:32:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Use metadata from volume on instance

This patch configures the compute API to take the metadata passed
from the volume api and add it to the instance.  This means that
metadata contained within a glance image and passed to a cinder
volume will also be passed to an instance booted from that volume.

I realise that there are no tests submitted with this patch,
they will follow however I would appreciate comments on this
approach.

Fixes bug 1166770

Change-Id: Ie252b9426f216ebe8a59936be6c3c8fabb597b64
'}]
commit_message:
Use metadata from volume on instance

This patch configures the compute API to take the metadata passed
from the volume api and add it to the instance.  This means that
metadata contained within a glance image and passed to a cinder
volume will also be passed to an instance booted from that volume.

I realise that there are no tests submitted with this patch,
they will follow however I would appreciate comments on this
approach.

Fixes bug 1166770

Change-Id: Ie252b9426f216ebe8a59936be6c3c8fabb597b64

subject: xenapi - cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2013-05-12 16:31:35.000000000', 'files': ['tools/xen/prepare_guest.sh', 'tools/xen/install_os_domU.sh', 'tools/xen/scripts/install_ubuntu_template.sh', 'tools/xen/xenrc', 'tools/xen/prepare_guest_template.sh', 'tools/xen/README.md'], 'message': 'xenapi - cleanup

Add error on unitialised variable to the scripts. This way some issues
were identified. Also modify README with fresh variables. The patch
includes:
 - Add SWIFT_HASH to the README
 - Add XENAPI_CONNECTION_URL to the README
 - Add VNCSERVER_PROXYCLIENT_ADDRESS to the README
 - Introduce UBUNTU_INST_IFACE which is the OpenStack VM interface used
   for the netinstall. It defaults to eth3. Previously this parameter
   was set by the combination of HOST_IP_IFACE and the undocumented
   NETINSTALL_IP
 - get rid of NETINSTALL_IP
 - xenrc includes CLEAN_TEMPLATES
 - xenrc no longer tries to change directory
 - remove chrooting from prepare_guest.sh (STAGING_DIR was always / )
 - remove DO_TGZ variable from prepare_guest.sh
 - use arguments to call prepare_guest.sh, instead of env vars
 - Fix backslash escaping in prepare_guest_template.sh

NOTE: networking is about to be addressed in a separate change.

Related to blueprint xenapi-devstack-cleanup

Change-Id: Ie9a75321c7f41cc9a0cc051398d1e6ec2c88adfa
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi - cleanup

Add error on unitialised variable to the scripts. This way some issues
were identified. Also modify README with fresh variables. The patch
includes:
 - Add SWIFT_HASH to the README
 - Add XENAPI_CONNECTION_URL to the README
 - Add VNCSERVER_PROXYCLIENT_ADDRESS to the README
 - Introduce UBUNTU_INST_IFACE which is the OpenStack VM interface used
   for the netinstall. It defaults to eth3. Previously this parameter
   was set by the combination of HOST_IP_IFACE and the undocumented
   NETINSTALL_IP
 - get rid of NETINSTALL_IP
 - xenrc includes CLEAN_TEMPLATES
 - xenrc no longer tries to change directory
 - remove chrooting from prepare_guest.sh (STAGING_DIR was always / )
 - remove DO_TGZ variable from prepare_guest.sh
 - use arguments to call prepare_guest.sh, instead of env vars
 - Fix backslash escaping in prepare_guest_template.sh

NOTE: networking is about to be addressed in a separate change.

Related to blueprint xenapi-devstack-cleanup

Change-Id: Ie9a75321c7f41cc9a0cc051398d1e6ec2c88adfa

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Switch to noun-verb command forms

Reverse the commands to use nouns followed by
verbs to allow users to take full advantage of
tab completion.

Compound nouns (e.g., "floating-ip") are also
reversed (e.g., "ip floating list" and "ip fixed list").

blueprint nouns-vs-verbs

Change-Id: Icf09fb8d7dbd09772bddbbeb74f9a379d9189b72
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

subject: engine : make check_active more generic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-10 10:28:14.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_metadata_refresh.py', 'heat/engine/resources/autoscaling.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance.py', 'heat/tests/test_autoscaling.py', 'heat/engine/resources/instance.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance_group.py'], 'message': 'engine : make check_active more generic

Make the check_active interface into check_status, which is more generic
and will be more flexible when reusing the handle_create/check_active
pattern for non CREATE_COMPLETE transitions (e.g update, delete, suspend)

This interface adds a state variable to the check_status arguments, so
resources can potentially check different things depending on the state
we're expecting to transition to - e.g "active" is really an artefact of
the instance implementation for CREATE_COMPLETE transistions

Fixes bug #1178591

Change-Id: I6cc22b6913fa1227a024ba064b6e5c282275592e
'}]
commit_message:
engine : make check_active more generic

Make the check_active interface into check_status, which is more generic
and will be more flexible when reusing the handle_create/check_active
pattern for non CREATE_COMPLETE transitions (e.g update, delete, suspend)

This interface adds a state variable to the check_status arguments, so
resources can potentially check different things depending on the state
we're expecting to transition to - e.g "active" is really an artefact of
the instance implementation for CREATE_COMPLETE transistions

Fixes bug #1178591

Change-Id: I6cc22b6913fa1227a024ba064b6e5c282275592e

commit_message:
blueprint mellanox-quantum-plugin

Implements Mellanox Quantum plugin.
This plugin implements Quantum v2 APIs with support for Mellanox embedded
switch functionality as part of the VPI (Ethernet/InfiniBand) HCA.

revisions:

The fixed network gets his name when you use the:
nova-manage network create "$PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME" $FIXED_RANGE 1 $FIXED_NETWORK_SIZE $NETWORK_CREATE_ARGS
command.

It can be different in every deployment, so it must be configurable.

Change-Id: I5c724565561b1a230372b8fc1693cb81fea3117e
'}]
commit_message:
Configurable fixed network name

The fixed network gets his name when you use the:
nova-manage network create "$PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME" $FIXED_RANGE 1 $FIXED_NETWORK_SIZE $NETWORK_CREATE_ARGS
command.

It can be different in every deployment, so it must be configurable.

Change-Id: I5c724565561b1a230372b8fc1693cb81fea3117e

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2284, 'name': 'Eoghan Glynn', 'email': 'eglynn@redhat.com', 'username': 'eglynn'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 4491, 'name': 'Lianhao Lu', 'email': 'lianhao.lu@intel.com', 'username': 'lianhao-lu'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2013-05-10 11:26:10.000000000', 'files': ['tests/api/v2/test_list_resources.py', 'ceilometer/api/v1/blueprint.py', 'ceilometer/api/acl.py', 'ceilometer/api/app.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py', 'tests/api/v2/test_acl.py', 'tests/api/v2/test_post_samples.py', 'ceilometer/api/v1/acl.py'], 'message': "Do the same auth checks in the v2 API as in the v1 API

- Don't limit access to admin.
- Reuse the get_limit_to_project() function from v1/acl.py

This requires some patches to wsme to fix the Response status (so we
can set it to a 401). We don't have this yet, so I am posting an
interim patch. Once we have the next version of wsme I'll fix the
status_code that is returned (see the TODO comments).

Change-Id: Ib39f045b3f9c4ff1f851e13d528fd117aed45c34
"}]
commit_message:
Do the same auth checks in the v2 API as in the v1 API

- Don't limit access to admin.
- Reuse the get_limit_to_project() function from v1/acl.py

This requires some patches to wsme to fix the Response status (so we
can set it to a 401). We don't have this yet, so I am posting an
interim patch. Once we have the next version of wsme I'll fix the
status_code that is returned (see the TODO comments).

Change-Id: Ib39f045b3f9c4ff1f851e13d528fd117aed45c34

commit_message:
perf: Decrease time to create a claim by ~1 us

A simple change to the way kwargs was constructed made a signficant
change in efficiency. Other places where the helpers.purge function
are used will be optimized once Falcon releases support for storing
results directly in a dict, unless they are None, making the purge
function unnecessary.

Implements: Blueprint bp/v1-obvious-optimizations
Change-Id: I9abe4d497cedd7963ae0cccd85bc1096d20994a1

subject: Eradicate eventlet and fix bug lp:959221
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-11 03:43:10.000000000', 'files': ['tools/test-requires', 'tests/utils.py', 'swiftclient/client.py'], 'message': "Eradicate eventlet and fix bug lp:959221

The bug is simple: whenever swift uploads to a Swift with SSL,
it uses 100% CPU. It happens because we use HTTPSConnection from
eventlet that loops like that, while holding the interpreter lock.

Now, it could be fixed in eventlet, but let's try something more
natural: drop the eventlet's HTTP client. We do not use green
threads in the client anymore, so it's not like we need it for that.

Note that in most cases clients do not use the BufferedHTTPConnection
either, because it's only installed on Swift server nodes, not on
workstations. Get rid of that too.

bug: 959221
Change-Id: I1eb932779d4171598b3efaa043f817b9c6c995c4
"}]
commit_message:
Eradicate eventlet and fix bug lp:959221

The bug is simple: whenever swift uploads to a Swift with SSL,
it uses 100% CPU. It happens because we use HTTPSConnection from
eventlet that loops like that, while holding the interpreter lock.

Now, it could be fixed in eventlet, but let's try something more
natural: drop the eventlet's HTTP client. We do not use green
threads in the client anymore, so it's not like we need it for that.

Note that in most cases clients do not use the BufferedHTTPConnection
either, because it's only installed on Swift server nodes, not on
workstations. Get rid of that too.

bug: 959221
Change-Id: I1eb932779d4171598b3efaa043f817b9c6c995c4

fixes bug 1178223
DocImpact

Currently users get very confused when first trying out openstack
on XenAPI becuase the VM boot is hugely slowed down by waiting
for the guest agent.

We may move to deprecate the use of the agent this release,
and this is a good step in that direction too.

A later change will start to control the agent per image.

Change-Id: I7436b026e6672744537dbb6a4b767225f37e5883
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: disable the xenapi agent by default

fixes bug 1178223
DocImpact

Currently users get very confused when first trying out openstack
on XenAPI becuase the VM boot is hugely slowed down by waiting
for the guest agent.

We may move to deprecate the use of the agent this release,
and this is a good step in that direction too.

A later change will start to control the agent per image.

Change-Id: I7436b026e6672744537dbb6a4b767225f37e5883

commit_message:
Add multi range support for segemented objects.

With this implementation, swift can now support requests using
multiple ranges such as Range:bytes=1-3, 5-10, 20-50 against both
single and segmented objects. This patch completes the multi range
support blueprint.

Change-Id: I7481ac89ae864163d3c4967cad20c34ea84799bf

commit_message:
Set default values for NFS/GlusterFS share_config files

By default, set:
 nfs_shares_config = /etc/cinder/nfs_shares
 glusterfs_shares_config = /etc/cinder/glusterfs_shares

This makes use of these drivers require one less manual
configuration step.

Also fix wording of help for glusterfs/nfs_mount_point_base
options.

Change-Id: I93bd3a8f08d4d5307f78e983d1080afae663dfe4

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 6473, 'name': 'Sunil Thaha', 'email': 'sthaha@redhat.com', 'username': 'sthaha'}, {'_account_id': 6526, 'name': 'David Geng', 'email': 'gengjh@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'genggjh'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2013-05-08 01:31:25.000000000', 'files': ['functions', 'stack.sh'], 'message': "Basic check for homedir permissions

Several guides suggest using data directories under your homedir,
rather than the default /opt area.  This is fine, but on RHEL6 and
similar distros homedirs are very restrictive 0700 permissions which
doesn't allow things like httpd to pass through to serve up files.

Even though stack.sh is taking over the host, changing permissions
automatically is not a nice idea.  So we just warn when it looks like
this is happening.

Change-Id: I9cd70e7fe90638a2a5c3b8fd94756afacac7c7be
"}]
commit_message:
Basic check for homedir permissions

Several guides suggest using data directories under your homedir,
rather than the default /opt area.  This is fine, but on RHEL6 and
similar distros homedirs are very restrictive 0700 permissions which
doesn't allow things like httpd to pass through to serve up files.

Even though stack.sh is taking over the host, changing permissions
automatically is not a nice idea.  So we just warn when it looks like
this is happening.

Change-Id: I9cd70e7fe90638a2a5c3b8fd94756afacac7c7be

subject: OVS cleanup utility removes veth pairs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-12 06:03:01.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/tests/unit/test_agent_ovs_cleanup.py', 'quantum/agent/ovs_cleanup_util.py'], 'message': 'OVS cleanup utility removes veth pairs

Fixes bug 1094185

OVSInterfaceDriver plug() creates a veth pair and add it to an OVS
bridge when ovs_use_veth=True. It is useful that OVS cleanup utility
removes such veth paris in addition to removing OVS ports.

Veth pairs to be removed are veth devices corresponding to ports
removed when all_ovs_port==False. Veth pairs created to connect
the integration bridge and physical bridges are not removed.

Change-Id: Ia87f0464e69a45dd0bdfd907ac71a003df9fc23f
'}]
commit_message:
OVS cleanup utility removes veth pairs

Fixes bug 1094185

OVSInterfaceDriver plug() creates a veth pair and add it to an OVS
bridge when ovs_use_veth=True. It is useful that OVS cleanup utility
removes such veth paris in addition to removing OVS ports.

Veth pairs to be removed are veth devices corresponding to ports
removed when all_ovs_port==False. Veth pairs created to connect
the integration bridge and physical bridges are not removed.

Change-Id: Ia87f0464e69a45dd0bdfd907ac71a003df9fc23f

commit_message:
in dhcp_agent, always use quantum.conf root_helper

Fixes bug #1178003.

For the most part, the dhcp agent uses the root_helper setting from the [AGENT]
section of /etc/quantum/quantum.conf. However, in a couple of spots, the
root_helper setting from the [DEFAULT] section of /etc/quantum/dhcp_agent.ini
was being used.

Change-Id: Id2f3140374a705cf7a0d2a784e4f321cc54f602e

   (e.g. RHEL 6.5) so long as ovs_use_veth is set to True.

commit_message:
Create veth peer in namespace.

 * Update veth pair creation to set the namespace of the peer
   device on creation rather than subsequently adding it to the
   namespace.
 * This change supports kernels with limited namespace support
   (e.g. RHEL 6.5) so long as ovs_use_veth is set to True.
 * Addresses bug 1171727

Change-Id: I1885acc9934e7627bb9872703df7f5edf2980722

subject: Allow 2 TempURL keys per account.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-05-03 00:18:17.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/tempurl.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempurl.py'], 'message': "Allow 2 TempURL keys per account.

This allows users to rotate their TempURL keys without invalidating
all existing signed URLs. This is handy if you have multiple systems
generating signed URLs, but you want to change your keys for some
reason (e.g. keys compromised, company policy, general paranoia).

Both the first and second keys are optional, so existing accounts'
signed URLs will continue to work as before.

This commit does change the memcache key used to store the fetched
TempURL keys. This is because we were storing the old key as a string
in memcached, but the new one is a list of keys. Since the key cache
lifetime here is only 60 seconds, it doesn't seem like too big a deal
to completely flush the TempURL cache.

Also, this commit adds caching of a negative TempURL result. If the
account HEAD reveals no TempURL keys at all, that result is now stored
for 60 seconds the same way that a positive result would be.

Change-Id: I40a02bd607283fbce11aa52a9bb8a5846ab17f5e
"}]
commit_message:
Allow 2 TempURL keys per account.

This allows users to rotate their TempURL keys without invalidating
all existing signed URLs. This is handy if you have multiple systems
generating signed URLs, but you want to change your keys for some
reason (e.g. keys compromised, company policy, general paranoia).

Both the first and second keys are optional, so existing accounts'
signed URLs will continue to work as before.

This commit does change the memcache key used to store the fetched
TempURL keys. This is because we were storing the old key as a string
in memcached, but the new one is a list of keys. Since the key cache
lifetime here is only 60 seconds, it doesn't seem like too big a deal
to completely flush the TempURL cache.

Also, this commit adds caching of a negative TempURL result. If the
account HEAD reveals no TempURL keys at all, that result is now stored
for 60 seconds the same way that a positive result would be.

Change-Id: I40a02bd607283fbce11aa52a9bb8a5846ab17f5e

subject: Handle ints passed to `boolean_from_string`
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-10 23:29:43.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_strutils.py', 'openstack/common/strutils.py'], 'message': "Handle ints passed to `boolean_from_string`

The existing code would return True for '1' but False for int(1),
unlike Nova's version which would return True for both inputs.

Nova's version feels safer (i.e. it will do the most-likely-correct
thing if an int is passed in), so this patch changes
Openstack-Common's version to match.

Note that this patch does not make Openstack-Common's
`boolean_from_string` match Nova's `bool_from_string` exactly though.
Nova's version would return True for both '42' and 42, while
Openstack-Common's returns False. Though Nova's version, again, seems
safer, the presence of unit-tests in Openstack-Common asserting the
defined-correctness of this behavior makes me reluctant to change it.

Fixes bug 1178760

Change-Id: I8b2a31c4852884187bcbda3a4e78c8513b1bb8c8
"}]
commit_message:
Handle ints passed to `boolean_from_string`

The existing code would return True for '1' but False for int(1),
unlike Nova's version which would return True for both inputs.

Nova's version feels safer (i.e. it will do the most-likely-correct
thing if an int is passed in), so this patch changes
Openstack-Common's version to match.

Note that this patch does not make Openstack-Common's
`boolean_from_string` match Nova's `bool_from_string` exactly though.
Nova's version would return True for both '42' and 42, while
Openstack-Common's returns False. Though Nova's version, again, seems
safer, the presence of unit-tests in Openstack-Common asserting the
defined-correctness of this behavior makes me reluctant to change it.

Fixes bug 1178760

Change-Id: I8b2a31c4852884187bcbda3a4e78c8513b1bb8c8

subject: make status_timeout a method
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-05-11 15:53:18.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/network/common.py', 'tempest/tests/compute/servers/test_server_advanced_ops.py', 'tempest/tests/compute/servers/test_server_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/test.py'], 'message': 'make status_timeout a method

status_timeout was previously a function, which took an object as
the first parameter always. So it was called as:

test.status_timeout(self, ...)

which is craziness. If self is always the first param it should be
a method to make it.

self.status_timeout(...)

This is needed as part of the scenario refactoring.

part of bp:tempest-repo-restructure

Change-Id: I6c9570155e92711f99129e8e8736ddecc50e1f26
'}]
commit_message:
make status_timeout a method

status_timeout was previously a function, which took an object as
the first parameter always. So it was called as:

test.status_timeout(self, ...)

which is craziness. If self is always the first param it should be
a method to make it.

self.status_timeout(...)

This is needed as part of the scenario refactoring.

part of bp:tempest-repo-restructure

Change-Id: I6c9570155e92711f99129e8e8736ddecc50e1f26

subject: Added ssync option for object replicator
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 1009, 'name': 'Greg Lange', 'email': 'greglange@gmail.com', 'username': 'greglange'}, {'_account_id': 1216, 'name': 'gholt', 'email': 'z-launchpad@brim.net', 'username': 'gholt'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 5600, 'name': 'Brian Cline', 'email': 'bcline@softlayer.com', 'username': 'briancline'}, {'_account_id': 7388, 'name': 'Kevin Landreth', 'email': 'crackerjackmack@gmail.com', 'username': 'crackerjackmack'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-05-01 14:45:57.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/deployment_guide.rst', 'swift/obj/server.py', 'bin/swift-object-server', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py', 'swift/common/wsgi.py', 'doc/source/overview_replication.rst', 'swift/proxy/server.py', 'test/unit/common/test_wsgi.py', 'etc/object-server.conf-sample', 'swift/common/exceptions.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_auditor.py', 'swift/obj/replicator.py', 'swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/common/test_exceptions.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Added ssync option for object replicator

This is just part one of likely many to implement
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/object-replicator2

I'm doing my best to alter as little as possible, especially in the
unit tests. This is both to keep the review-patch to a minimum and to
ensure I don't introduce bugs the tests would've caught had I not
touched them. This does mean that some code that has moved modules
have not had their tests moved too. Also, some code may not be
exactly where or exactly formatted like we might want it eventually.
I'd like to leave such refactors to follow-on patches to keep this
one as small and confident as possible.

Here's an overview of what I changed and added:

Moved Functionality: To avoid circular imports

    Moved tpool_reraise from swift.obj.replicator to swift.common.utils.

    Moved get_hashes, HASH_FILE, hash_suffix, invalidate_hash,
    ONE_WEEK, PICKLE_PROTOCOL, quarantine_renamer from
    swift.obj.replicator to swift.obj.server.

Moved Config Items:

    Moved the conn_timeout, disk_chunk_size, network_chunk_size, and
    node_timeout configuration items in object-server.conf to the
    [DEFAULT] section so both the object-server and object-replicator
    (and any others) have access to them.

Object Replicator Changes:

    Renamed sync to rsync and made a new sync method that calls a
    configurable sync method.

    Created a new EXPERIMENTAL ssync method that works just like the
    rsync method but uses Swift-only functionality. This sends
    objects over using HTTP-based REPLICATION calls to the remote
    object server. REPLICATION calls are just a form of request
    pipelining for speed and to allow the remote host to more easily
    limit incoming replication.

Object Server Changes:

    Added new IterFile to change an iter into a file-like object that
    can be used as wsgi.input.

    Added REPLICATION method to accept new ssync type requests.

Change-Id: I778303d19582fe819a0f170f6667b7ac2dab9652
"}]
commit_message:
Added ssync option for object replicator

This is just part one of likely many to implement
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/object-replicator2

I'm doing my best to alter as little as possible, especially in the
unit tests. This is both to keep the review-patch to a minimum and to
ensure I don't introduce bugs the tests would've caught had I not
touched them. This does mean that some code that has moved modules
have not had their tests moved too. Also, some code may not be
exactly where or exactly formatted like we might want it eventually.
I'd like to leave such refactors to follow-on patches to keep this
one as small and confident as possible.

Here's an overview of what I changed and added:

Moved Functionality: To avoid circular imports

    Moved tpool_reraise from swift.obj.replicator to swift.common.utils.

    Moved get_hashes, HASH_FILE, hash_suffix, invalidate_hash,
    ONE_WEEK, PICKLE_PROTOCOL, quarantine_renamer from
    swift.obj.replicator to swift.obj.server.

Moved Config Items:

    Moved the conn_timeout, disk_chunk_size, network_chunk_size, and
    node_timeout configuration items in object-server.conf to the
    [DEFAULT] section so both the object-server and object-replicator
    (and any others) have access to them.

Object Replicator Changes:

    Renamed sync to rsync and made a new sync method that calls a
    configurable sync method.

    Created a new EXPERIMENTAL ssync method that works just like the
    rsync method but uses Swift-only functionality. This sends
    objects over using HTTP-based REPLICATION calls to the remote
    object server. REPLICATION calls are just a form of request
    pipelining for speed and to allow the remote host to more easily
    limit incoming replication.

Object Server Changes:

    Added new IterFile to change an iter into a file-like object that
    can be used as wsgi.input.

    Added REPLICATION method to accept new ssync type requests.

Change-Id: I778303d19582fe819a0f170f6667b7ac2dab9652

subject: Add notification for live migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-08 16:06:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Add notification for live migration

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1167759

Currently, if live migration failed, nova compute did not send
notification, this caused other service such as nova-scheduler
has no chance to do some operation based on the result of live
migration.

The fix add notification logic for live_migration like other
VM instance operations such as resize, run instance etc.

Change-Id: I93db7599d5dab6a86aee070527bb5c18b44ba9d4
'}]
commit_message:
Add notification for live migration

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1167759

Currently, if live migration failed, nova compute did not send
notification, this caused other service such as nova-scheduler
has no chance to do some operation based on the result of live
migration.

The fix add notification logic for live_migration like other
VM instance operations such as resize, run instance etc.

Change-Id: I93db7599d5dab6a86aee070527bb5c18b44ba9d4

subject: Do not require sudo/rootwrap to check for dnsmasq version
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-11 07:42:15.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/rootwrap/filters.py', 'quantum/agent/linux/dhcp.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/test_linux_dhcp.py', 'etc/quantum/rootwrap.d/dhcp.filters', 'quantum/agent/dhcp_agent.py'], 'message': "Do not require sudo/rootwrap to check for dnsmasq version

The dnsmasq version check does not need root privileges
to run as with low privs it works just fine. As a side
effect, the use of the rootwrapper was causing unit tests
to hung because the execute call in check_version was not
being stubbed out. Weirdly enough this wasn't caught in
a previous Gerrit run; there must be a passwordless sudo
lurking around somewhere in the Gerrit infrastructure.

Fixes bug #1178800

Change-Id: I4d0bd218768eec2439d3907587682ff35884a262
"}]
commit_message:
Do not require sudo/rootwrap to check for dnsmasq version

The dnsmasq version check does not need root privileges
to run as with low privs it works just fine. As a side
effect, the use of the rootwrapper was causing unit tests
to hung because the execute call in check_version was not
being stubbed out. Weirdly enough this wasn't caught in
a previous Gerrit run; there must be a passwordless sudo
lurking around somewhere in the Gerrit infrastructure.

Fixes bug #1178800

Change-Id: I4d0bd218768eec2439d3907587682ff35884a262

We ask qemu regularly if the virtual size of a disk image has changed,
yet the only time it actually will is if we resize the image. We can
therefore cache this information.

To achieve this, I've moved the recently added memoize decorator out
of the EC2 API and into utils. Doing that required making it a little

commit_message:
Cache "qemu-img info" calls.

We ask qemu regularly if the virtual size of a disk image has changed,
yet the only time it actually will is if we resize the image. We can
therefore cache this information.

To achieve this, I've moved the recently added memoize decorator out
of the EC2 API and into utils. Doing that required making it a little
more generic as well.

Resolves bug 1154162.

Change-Id: I133619f4a2a2707a84b254e951d005689b69ba39

commit_message:
Raise a more significant error when volume attaching fail.

This patch raise a new exception rather than DeviceIsBusy error
to include more general cases while including the message returned
by libvirt library which is descriptive enough of where and what fail.

Change-Id: Ie0fc2880b75c139f74fddb6b50f66de70c8f296e
Fixes: LP#1168011

The snapshot would always be in the queued or SAVING status
after the VM is deleted or nova compute service is shutdown.
So I combined the review comments from the code review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24820 and review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25236, adding an error status
for image in glance, and make nove to update the glance image

resolve bug 1064386

Change-Id: I21ee9c63ac9131acc9e819c7a018f7d90ecede41
'}]
commit_message:
Keep snapshot in saving status after instance deleted

The snapshot would always be in the queued or SAVING status
after the VM is deleted or nova compute service is shutdown.
So I combined the review comments from the code review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24820 and review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25236, adding an error status
for image in glance, and make nove to update the glance image
status via python-glanceclient.

resolve bug 1143659
resolve bug 1064386

Change-Id: I21ee9c63ac9131acc9e819c7a018f7d90ecede41

commit_message:
Check if domain_id present in user and tenant refs.

LDAP backend does not yet add domain_id to these refs. To make LDAP
backend work we need to check if such key exists prior to its usage.

commit_message:
Make service tenant name configurable in keystone::roles::admin

Though "services" seems to be a fairly common name for the service
tenant, some people may prefer to use "service" or some other name.

The puppet-glance module, and others, do allow overriding the
service tenant name.

Change-Id: I4764cbf21821db96fac93ea4abdaf7d14bd12771

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-05-10 18:23:57.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/README.rst'], 'message': "proposal for tempest directory restructure

This is the text of a proposal for tempest directory restructure,
largely coming out of OpenStack summit. Once this has gotten core
sign off, I'llstart implementing the refactors into those
directories, and each will have a more specific README explaining
good tests in that kind of environment.

This proposal doesn't attempt to layout structure for tests we
don't have yet, this is entirely about organizing what we have into
something easier to understand. It is assumed new classes of tests
will get proposed over time, and we'll take them as they come.

Part of bp:tempest-repo-restructure

Change-Id: Ib8c55602b085622d322676ba2c24d9719fb9737d
"}]
commit_message:
proposal for tempest directory restructure

This is the text of a proposal for tempest directory restructure,
largely coming out of OpenStack summit. Once this has gotten core
sign off, I'llstart implementing the refactors into those
directories, and each will have a more specific README explaining
good tests in that kind of environment.

This proposal doesn't attempt to layout structure for tests we
don't have yet, this is entirely about organizing what we have into
something easier to understand. It is assumed new classes of tests
will get proposed over time, and we'll take them as they come.

Part of bp:tempest-repo-restructure

Change-Id: Ib8c55602b085622d322676ba2c24d9719fb9737d

commit_message:
Add sqlalchemy migration utils.create_shadow_table method

This method allows to create shadow table by existing table.

Two use cases:
a) create shadow table by table name
b) create shadow table from table instance

blueprint db-improve-archiving

Change-Id: Ib3a3797782b89a9a89baa60738edcabde7fe1299

subject: Add sqlalchemy migration utils.check_shadow_table method
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-05-08 21:27:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/utils.py', 'nova/tests/test_migration_utils.py', 'nova/tests/test_migrations.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Add sqlalchemy migration utils.check_shadow_table method

This method check that our table with name `xxx`:
1) Has shadow table `shadow_xxx`
2) All columns in `xxx` are also in `shadow_xxx` (with same type)
3) There is no extra columns in `shadow_xxx`

Will be used to check that all shadow tables are up-to-date.

blueprint db-improve-archiving

Change-Id: I0b366afe1b7d8703ab9c49a68977202b82d844fc
'}]
commit_message:
Add sqlalchemy migration utils.check_shadow_table method

This method check that our table with name `xxx`:
1) Has shadow table `shadow_xxx`
2) All columns in `xxx` are also in `shadow_xxx` (with same type)
3) There is no extra columns in `shadow_xxx`

Will be used to check that all shadow tables are up-to-date.

blueprint db-improve-archiving

Change-Id: I0b366afe1b7d8703ab9c49a68977202b82d844fc

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2013-05-10 17:40:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_powervm.py', 'nova/virt/powervm/blockdev.py', 'nova/virt/powervm/common.py', 'nova/virt/powervm/operator.py'], 'message': "Check cached SSH connection in PowerVM driver

The PowerVM operator code caches an SSH connection to the hypervisor
which can become invalid if the connection to the hypervisor is not
terminated cleanly, e.g. the hypervisor is rebooted while the compute
node is connected to it.

This code checks an existing SSH connection object to see if it's
transport is still alive and if not, re-establishes the connection
before attempting to run SSH commands on the hypervisor.

Also added some basic unit tests to cover the new check_connection
function in nova.virt.powervm.common.

Fixes bug 1177104

Change-Id: I08079cf0d9e60e1d8902d32d684d979b06f7f287
"}]
commit_message:
Check cached SSH connection in PowerVM driver

The PowerVM operator code caches an SSH connection to the hypervisor
which can become invalid if the connection to the hypervisor is not
terminated cleanly, e.g. the hypervisor is rebooted while the compute
node is connected to it.

This code checks an existing SSH connection object to see if it's
transport is still alive and if not, re-establishes the connection
before attempting to run SSH commands on the hypervisor.

Also added some basic unit tests to cover the new check_connection
function in nova.virt.powervm.common.

Fixes bug 1177104

Change-Id: I08079cf0d9e60e1d8902d32d684d979b06f7f287

subject: move installation of mysql and pg drivers to run_tests.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-10 21:25:46.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh', 'tools/test-requires', 'tools/pip-requires'], 'message': 'move installation of mysql and pg drivers to run_tests.sh

the gate is currently switching to using tox to drive tempest,
making it possible for us to define what a full and smoke run are
like in the tempest tree.

However, in a full run only 1 database is installed, so tox fails
to bring in the venv for both databases, and explodes.

Move installing the db parts into run tests manually to get us
past the current blockage.

Change-Id: Idf3d495357f66c22287c42f3c84cd401c171ec94
'}]
commit_message:
move installation of mysql and pg drivers to run_tests.sh

the gate is currently switching to using tox to drive tempest,
making it possible for us to define what a full and smoke run are
like in the tempest tree.

However, in a full run only 1 database is installed, so tox fails
to bring in the venv for both databases, and explodes.

Move installing the db parts into run tests manually to get us
past the current blockage.

Change-Id: Idf3d495357f66c22287c42f3c84cd401c171ec94

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-10 21:58:52.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/server.pp'], 'message': "Server: correctly set Keystone service password

$keystone_password does not exist as a class parameter,
$auth_password does. The previous behavior would result in perpetual
authentication failures when Quantum would try to authenticate to

Change-Id: Ie89eecb3efab61ca9fa280b4a5bc530d1053d074
"}]
commit_message:
Server: correctly set Keystone service password

$keystone_password does not exist as a class parameter,
$auth_password does. The previous behavior would result in perpetual
authentication failures when Quantum would try to authenticate to
Keystone with the literal '%SERVICE_PASSWORD%' as the password.

Change-Id: Ie89eecb3efab61ca9fa280b4a5bc530d1053d074

commit_message:
Allow different paths for deploy-helper helpers.

Different distros (or even distro releases) put iscsiadm in potentially
arbitrary paths. It is better to use rootwraps' own search than to hardcode the
path.

Fixes bug 1178612

Change-Id: I690788b666a84e599504690d0e2d087eaa66a4c8

commit_message:
Allow a floating IP to be associated to a specific fixed IP

The current floating IP API extension only accepts the instance ID
and the floating address to be assigned. Where the instance is
connected to more than one network the behaviour is to associated
the floating IP with the first fixed IP of the instances
(and to log a warning)

This change introduces a new extension which wehn loaded adds a
fixed IP address as an optional parameter, allowing the floating
IP to be associated with a specific fixed IP.

Without this extension, or without the optional parameters,
the API behaviour is unchanged.

If specified the fixed IP must be associated with the instance.

DocImpact

Implements blueprint multi-nic-floating-ip-assignment

Change-Id: I9241137ad794cdf7f452ed84e9445f0e11fdd44e

subject: Make resize/migrated shared storage aware
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 191, 'name': 'Trey Morris', 'email': 'trey.morris@rackspace.com', 'username': 'tr3buchet'}, {'_account_id': 1525, 'name': 'Rafi Khardalian', 'email': 'rafi@metacloud.com', 'username': 'rkhardalian'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1782, 'name': 'Kravchenko Pavel', 'email': 'kpavel@il.ibm.com', 'username': 'kravchenko-pavel'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2667, 'name': 'Alex Glikson', 'email': 'glikson@il.ibm.com', 'username': 'glikson'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-05-09 20:47:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/test_libvirt.py'], 'message': 'Make resize/migrated shared storage aware

Fixes bug 1177247

Added some logic to check for whether or not we are on a shared
filesystem and set shared_storage accordingly. We perform similar
checks in other areas of the code, typically through RPC calls.
However, all the resize/migrate code is slated to be refactored for
Hava, so the idea was to keep this patch as minimally intrusive as
possible.

When shared_storage is true, we pass that on to the cleanup call
so that it no longer executes an rm via SSH, which was ultimately
destroying the original instance directory.

Change-Id: Ie9decedd373c000211c171df64e1e96fe78e5081
'}]
commit_message:
Make resize/migrated shared storage aware

Fixes bug 1177247

Added some logic to check for whether or not we are on a shared
filesystem and set shared_storage accordingly. We perform similar
checks in other areas of the code, typically through RPC calls.
However, all the resize/migrate code is slated to be refactored for
Hava, so the idea was to keep this patch as minimally intrusive as
possible.

When shared_storage is true, we pass that on to the cleanup call
so that it no longer executes an rm via SSH, which was ultimately
destroying the original instance directory.

Change-Id: Ie9decedd373c000211c171df64e1e96fe78e5081

commit_message:
Implement a proxy checker class.

Add a proxy checker class for local checks that doesn't do anything,
but instead registers a command option that allows for local, in-tree
checks.

subject: Change Daemon class to better match process command lines.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-10 19:19:04.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/agent/linux/daemon.py', 'quantum/agent/metadata/namespace_proxy.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/test_linux_daemon.py'], 'message': 'Change Daemon class to better match process command lines.

Add additional uuid argument Daemon class to help it better
match output from /proc/$id/cmdline to the correct daemon.
If there is a stale pid in the pidfile, and that process has
the same name, then it could match accidentally and not
start the daemon up properly.

Fixes bug 1177416

Change-Id: I1109ca73c539c5e96cbe3dbb55ce68c92013ee10
'}]
commit_message:
Change Daemon class to better match process command lines.

Add additional uuid argument Daemon class to help it better
match output from /proc/$id/cmdline to the correct daemon.
If there is a stale pid in the pidfile, and that process has
the same name, then it could match accidentally and not
start the daemon up properly.

Fixes bug 1177416

Change-Id: I1109ca73c539c5e96cbe3dbb55ce68c92013ee10

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-10 19:19:00.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/plugins/nicira/nicira_qos_db.py'], 'message': "Fix usage of SQLAlchemy Query.first() method

Query.first() doesn't raise the NoResultFound exception
if no result is found but rather returns None, so wrapping
of Query.first() call into a try/except NoResultFound block
is useless.

Fixes bug 1177842.

Change-Id: I0bd0e6d8299734b485dd1a1ac36bf6c295fd8932
"}]
commit_message:
Fix usage of SQLAlchemy Query.first() method

Query.first() doesn't raise the NoResultFound exception
if no result is found but rather returns None, so wrapping
of Query.first() call into a try/except NoResultFound block
is useless.

Fixes bug 1177842.

Change-Id: I0bd0e6d8299734b485dd1a1ac36bf6c295fd8932

subject: Fix usage of NexusPortBindingNotFound exception
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-05-10 19:08:27.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/plugins/cisco/nexus/cisco_nexus_plugin_v2.py', 'quantum/plugins/cisco/tests/unit/test_database.py', 'quantum/plugins/cisco/db/nexus_db_v2.py', 'quantum/plugins/cisco/common/cisco_exceptions.py'], 'message': "Fix usage of NexusPortBindingNotFound exception

Currently the required keyword argument (port_id)
is not passed when the exception is raised. In fact
this exception has never been raised before due to
another bug (1173131) so this change also has to
ensure it doesn't break any existing code using
functions which can possibly raise this exception.

Fixes bug 1174323.

Change-Id: I81f0b0def7db163fb0fbb5e03be511113c8d0be5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix usage of NexusPortBindingNotFound exception

Currently the required keyword argument (port_id)
is not passed when the exception is raised. In fact
this exception has never been raised before due to
another bug (1173131) so this change also has to
ensure it doesn't break any existing code using
functions which can possibly raise this exception.

Fixes bug 1174323.

Change-Id: I81f0b0def7db163fb0fbb5e03be511113c8d0be5

in Python code.

commit_message:
fix non reporting of failures with floating IP assignment

It seems that commit essex-1-1003-g9728ae5
inadvertently removed a 'raise', thus hiding
all processutils.ProcessExecutionError exceptions
apart from the one indicating "Interface not found".

Fixes bug: 1178658
Change-Id: I2bcf8c3a19ebebc81a38ce6bf7b54065d62834c0
(cherry picked from commit 175584f0afef308e1021bb4daf49cbf222a61a40)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5371, 'name': 'Mathew Odden', 'email': 'locke105@gmail.com', 'username': 'locke105'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-05-09 02:20:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Remove invalid block_device_mapping volume_size of ''

Fixes bug #1171190

Parsing block_device_mapping from strings sometimes results in
volume_size being set to '' or u''.  This causes a problem when
inserting into PostgreSQL, which insists that integer columns
actually contain integers.  Remove invalid device_size before
inserting or updating block_device_mapping database records.

Change-Id: If9132a96604b5b0e3a6df96624e565e016d5c9a3
"}]
commit_message:
Remove invalid block_device_mapping volume_size of ''

Fixes bug #1171190

Parsing block_device_mapping from strings sometimes results in
volume_size being set to '' or u''.  This causes a problem when
inserting into PostgreSQL, which insists that integer columns
actually contain integers.  Remove invalid device_size before
inserting or updating block_device_mapping database records.

Change-Id: If9132a96604b5b0e3a6df96624e565e016d5c9a3

commit_message:
fix non reporting of failures with floating IP assignment

It seems that commit essex-1-1003-g9728ae5
inadvertently removed a 'raise', thus hiding
all processutils.ProcessExecutionError exceptions
apart from the one indicating "Interface not found".

Fixes bug: 1178658

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 24, 'name': 'Chuck Short', 'email': 'charles.short@windriver.com', 'username': 'zulcss'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1994, 'name': 'Zhongyue Luo', 'email': 'zhongyue.luo@gmail.com', 'username': 'zyluo'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-05-07 16:56:15.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_strutils.py', 'tests/unit/test_wsgi.py', 'tests/unit/rpc/test_common.py', 'tools/pip-requires', 'doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Convert unicode strings for python3 portability

From http://docs.python.org/3.1/whatsnew/3.0.html

You can no longer use u"..." literals for Unicode text.
However, you must use b"..." literals for binary data. Use
python-six to make this migration easier.

Change-Id: I95166a07f4edf33be55a4bdf2674c2f238a06f19
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Convert unicode strings for python3 portability

From http://docs.python.org/3.1/whatsnew/3.0.html

You can no longer use u"..." literals for Unicode text.
However, you must use b"..." literals for binary data. Use
python-six to make this migration easier.

Change-Id: I95166a07f4edf33be55a4bdf2674c2f238a06f19
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-05-09 04:20:42.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/lockutils.py', 'tests/unit/test_lockutils.py'], 'message': "Added convenience APIs for lockutils

The lock_file_prefix for each project doesn't need to be configurable or
frequently changed. This patch provides a convenience API which returns
a partial object of the synchronized decorator to avoid passing the prefix
each time locks are used.

The set_defaults method is also provided to change the default value of

Fixes bug #1065524

Change-Id: I7b67f0a482da4be6d53a70db5bbd22dc91bdc10c
"}]
commit_message:
Added convenience APIs for lockutils

The lock_file_prefix for each project doesn't need to be configurable or
frequently changed. This patch provides a convenience API which returns
a partial object of the synchronized decorator to avoid passing the prefix
each time locks are used.

The set_defaults method is also provided to change the default value of
lock_path when needed.

Fixes bug #1065524

Change-Id: I7b67f0a482da4be6d53a70db5bbd22dc91bdc10c

commit_message:
Stylistic improvements from quantum-rootwrap

As part of the convergence effort between oslo-rootwrap and
quantum-rootwrap, import stylistic improvements introduced
in quantum-rootwrap, like:

- HACKING-compliant docstrings
- More elegant return construct from match_filter in filters.py
- Remove overridden use of filters in wrapper.py

Change-Id: I49a97271b1c385feb25adf4f62add5c71962b5dd

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-10 12:40:37.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/rootwrap/filters.py', 'quantum/agent/linux/dhcp.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/test_linux_dhcp.py', 'etc/quantum/rootwrap.d/dhcp.filters', 'quantum/agent/dhcp_agent.py'], 'message': 'Log a warning if dnsmasq version is below the minimum required

It has been noted that older versions of dnsmasq may have unexpected
behavior, so this patch introduces a check on dnsmasq version; if
the minimum version is not met, a warning is logged. This is less
invasive than raising an Exception and abort the dhcp agent, even
though this also seems like a perfectly acceptable behavior.

Fixes bug 1170793

Change-Id: Idd91c3753fb05f223ed0e3c53ad692ee65ea4905
'}]
commit_message:
Log a warning if dnsmasq version is below the minimum required

It has been noted that older versions of dnsmasq may have unexpected
behavior, so this patch introduces a check on dnsmasq version; if
the minimum version is not met, a warning is logged. This is less
invasive than raising an Exception and abort the dhcp agent, even
though this also seems like a perfectly acceptable behavior.

Fixes bug 1170793

Change-Id: Idd91c3753fb05f223ed0e3c53ad692ee65ea4905

subject: Disable eventlet monkey-patching of DNS
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-05-10 02:10:24.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/test.py', 'bin/keystone-all', 'keystone/__init__.py'], 'message': "Disable eventlet monkey-patching of DNS

This change avoids eventlet's monkey-patching of DNS
resolution. eventlet's doesn't support IPv6, for example.

The way to avoid eventlet's DNS is to set an environment
variable. The trick is the environment variable needs to be set
before eventlet is imported.

A similar change was made in nova, so this is just copying
that code and technique to keystone.

This allows re-enabling the IPv6 tests, too.

Change-Id: I30524a1cebd43580d692fd88ef32be45e62758c5
"}]
commit_message:
Disable eventlet monkey-patching of DNS

This change avoids eventlet's monkey-patching of DNS
resolution. eventlet's doesn't support IPv6, for example.

The way to avoid eventlet's DNS is to set an environment
variable. The trick is the environment variable needs to be set
before eventlet is imported.

A similar change was made in nova, so this is just copying
that code and technique to keystone.

This allows re-enabling the IPv6 tests, too.

Change-Id: I30524a1cebd43580d692fd88ef32be45e62758c5

revisions:

commit_message:
Change variable name of admin_state_down to admin_state

It is confusing that admin_state_down=False means admin-state is DOWN.
It is easy to understand if the variable name matches its value.

Also removes 'default=xxx' from options with store_true/false action
since store_true/false sets the default value implicitly.

Fixes bug 1161853

Change-Id: I3146dd8974990c94e5f9b3b5bf6a8b28a245d64e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-08 14:27:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/servicegroup/drivers/zk.py', 'nova/tests/servicegroup/test_zk_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix zookeeper import and tests

Import zookeeper.membership rather than zookeeper.membersip.
Also fixed some issues with setting up the tests for the zookeeper
servicegroup driver.  Config options were not being set before
initializing the driver leading to failures.

There is no added test for this because the bug is indistinguishable
from not having the zookeeper python modules installed, which leads to
skipping these servicegroup tests.

Bug 1177776

Change-Id: Idd6dca2e03169399b930cc1fc1a85636497cb0b5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix zookeeper import and tests

Import zookeeper.membership rather than zookeeper.membersip.
Also fixed some issues with setting up the tests for the zookeeper
servicegroup driver.  Config options were not being set before
initializing the driver leading to failures.

There is no added test for this because the bug is indistinguishable
from not having the zookeeper python modules installed, which leads to
skipping these servicegroup tests.

Bug 1177776

Change-Id: Idd6dca2e03169399b930cc1fc1a85636497cb0b5
