subject: Log a helpful error when VirtualPowerManager fails.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-01 21:48:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/baremetal/test_virtual_power_driver.py', 'nova/virt/baremetal/virtual_power_driver.py'], 'message': 'Log a helpful error when VirtualPowerManager fails.

Before, if VirtualPowerManager failed to connect to its
ssh host, the error which appeared in the log was this:
  "Instance bmtest found in the hypervisor, but not in the database"

This change causes a more specific error to be logged,
while retaining the behavior that nova-compute fails to
start if it cannot determine the power state of the baremetal
nodes it manages.

Bug: 1168610
Change-Id: I5ce2d8e8e5843340831f999870e203650f9d16d7
'}]
commit_message:
Log a helpful error when VirtualPowerManager fails.

Before, if VirtualPowerManager failed to connect to its
ssh host, the error which appeared in the log was this:
  "Instance bmtest found in the hypervisor, but not in the database"

This change causes a more specific error to be logged,
while retaining the behavior that nova-compute fails to
start if it cannot determine the power state of the baremetal
nodes it manages.

Bug: 1168610
Change-Id: I5ce2d8e8e5843340831f999870e203650f9d16d7

subject: Fix runnning first-boot.d scripts on fedora startup
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-10 06:03:04.000000000', 'files': ['lib/img-functions'], 'message': "Fix runnning first-boot.d scripts on fedora startup

The fedora rc-local service will look for /etc/rc.d/rc.local instead
of /etc/rc.local. So now we are going to check what OS is the image
and if it's a fedora image we are going to create the rc.local in the
appropriate directory.

Change-Id: I6762e31b86c1b8a33d4e93dba6f7a2b3808d4b04
"}]
commit_message:
Fix runnning first-boot.d scripts on fedora startup

The fedora rc-local service will look for /etc/rc.d/rc.local instead
of /etc/rc.local. So now we are going to check what OS is the image
and if it's a fedora image we are going to create the rc.local in the
appropriate directory.

Change-Id: I6762e31b86c1b8a33d4e93dba6f7a2b3808d4b04

commit_message:
Add support for break=all.

If $break contains "all", every possible breakpoint will be triggered.
This is a lot of breakpoints, so it is likely only a debugging option of
last resort.

Change-Id: Ia4f3e080697647c615a2437d0cfd5a13c499eac2

subject: Remove skips in test_images_oneserver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-24 17:03:50.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/compute/images/test_images_oneserver.py'], 'message': 'Remove skips in test_images_oneserver

* Remove this test case test_create_image_specify_multibyte_character_image_name

  This test case doesn't make sense as the snapshot name provided is a string
  and string can include any characters.
  In this test case, the snapshot_name passed is a valid string and a snapshot is
  successfully created. This is a negative test and it expects this operation to
  fail and hence this test case doesn't make sense"

Fixes bug 1006725

Change-Id: I18943d27e7643714f6c013cf13fd3d15b7f9efec
'}]
commit_message:
Remove skips in test_images_oneserver

* Remove this test case test_create_image_specify_multibyte_character_image_name

  This test case doesn't make sense as the snapshot name provided is a string
  and string can include any characters.
  In this test case, the snapshot_name passed is a valid string and a snapshot is
  successfully created. This is a negative test and it expects this operation to
  fail and hence this test case doesn't make sense"

Fixes bug 1006725

Change-Id: I18943d27e7643714f6c013cf13fd3d15b7f9efec

subject: Set default fixed_ip quota to unlimited.
revisions:

Change-Id: I32b3e3a9af7f94bda58a9a012cbe863d3abc0ca2

commit_message:
Set default fixed_ip quota to unlimited.

DocImpact: our previous default quota of ten was poorly thought through
and resulted in upgrade problems. Instead, let's have operators opt into
fixed IP quotas. This change should be mentioned in release notes please.

Resolves bug 1161190.

Change-Id: I32b3e3a9af7f94bda58a9a012cbe863d3abc0ca2

commit_message:
Improve test coverage for quantumclient.common.serializer module

OpenStack quantumclient.common.serializer package includes
a lot of components not covered with unit tests.

Add unittests for the following classes:
* Serializer
* XMLDictSerializer
* ActionDispatcher
* XMLDeserializer
* JSONDeserializer
* DictSerializer
* JSONDictSerializer
* TextDeserialize

Implements: blueprint quantumclient-serializer-unittests
Change-Id: Ifb7cffc13ecc812ac6dd57cc27d13dde968c88f8

subject: Doubling the ring
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2013-03-01 23:05:39.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py', 'test/unit/common/ring/test_builder.py', 'test/unit/common/ring/test_ring.py', 'swift/account/server.py', 'test/unit/container/test_server.py', 'swift/common/ring/builder.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_auditor.py', 'swift/container/server.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'bin/swift-ring-builder', 'swift/common/ring/__init__.py', 'test/unit/account/test_server.py', 'test/unit/container/test_replicator.py', 'test/unit/common/test_db_replicator.py', 'swift/common/mydata.py', 'swift/obj/auditor.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py', 'AUTHORS', 'swift/obj/replicator.py', 'test/probe/test_container_failures.py', 'swift/common/utils.py', 'swift/common/db_replicator.py', 'doc/manpages/swift-ring-builder.1', 'doc/source/overview_ring.rst', 'swift/common/ring/ring.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Doubling the ring

This patch adds support for ring size changes.
More specifically it allows to increase (but not decrease)
the ring by doubling every partition.

Doubling the ring changes the partition numbers meaning that
it may affect the directory structure of the a/c/o servers.
To overcome this, the patch includes the following additional
changes:
* The ring now holds a part_power per device which will never be changed.
* The storage_directory was changed to offer a stable path based on the
the device part_power
* The db_replicators were adjusted such that they find nodes based on
the hash used as part of the db path
* The object replicators were adjusted to hold multiple hash lists
per HASH FILE
* The object REPLICATE was extended to include a new header
carrying the sender's ring part_power.

This patch is fully backwards compatible.
The only change made to an existing installation is progressing the
HASH FILE to a new format without rehashing of objects.

The patch supports gradually upgrading existing installations to become
ready for a future ring doubling event.

Implements: blueprint ring-doubling
Change-Id: Icfe39d6c7a764ff976730c5819d579aef41efaab
"}]
commit_message:
Doubling the ring

This patch adds support for ring size changes.
More specifically it allows to increase (but not decrease)
the ring by doubling every partition.

Doubling the ring changes the partition numbers meaning that
it may affect the directory structure of the a/c/o servers.
To overcome this, the patch includes the following additional
changes:
* The ring now holds a part_power per device which will never be changed.
* The storage_directory was changed to offer a stable path based on the
the device part_power
* The db_replicators were adjusted such that they find nodes based on
the hash used as part of the db path
* The object replicators were adjusted to hold multiple hash lists
per HASH FILE
* The object REPLICATE was extended to include a new header
carrying the sender's ring part_power.

This patch is fully backwards compatible.
The only change made to an existing installation is progressing the
HASH FILE to a new format without rehashing of objects.

The patch supports gradually upgrading existing installations to become
ready for a future ring doubling event.

Implements: blueprint ring-doubling
Change-Id: Icfe39d6c7a764ff976730c5819d579aef41efaab

commit_message:
Adds --addn-hosts to the dnsmasq arg list

When using multi_host=True and update_dns_entries=True, dns records from
other compute hosts were not able to be resolved.  The --addn-host arg was
constructed but not appended to the cmd list.

Change-Id: I9cafb59256e92bdad0df3e9166e0afd079ae0c09
Fixes: bug #1170529
(cherry picked from commit 3922da72b2569976f25183c476cedcc17d32fa13)

subject: Fix EC2 instance bdm response
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-06 15:15:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/ec2/test_cinder_cloud.py', 'nova/tests/api/ec2/test_cloud.py', 'nova/api/ec2/cloud.py', 'nova/tests/fake_volume.py'], 'message': 'Fix EC2 instance bdm response

Make the bdm response respect Amazon EC2 spec:
 * use ec2 volume id instead of uuid
 * use volume attach_status instead of status

References:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-ItemType-EbsInstanceBlockDeviceMappingResponseType.html

Resolves bug 1165973.

Change-Id: Ib68397b79f63e01e92ed4bebbc245ba5e0a3ad11
(cherry picked from commit f48a2e1a68cca1ef147279b2ddf713635f494bc0)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix EC2 instance bdm response

Make the bdm response respect Amazon EC2 spec:
 * use ec2 volume id instead of uuid
 * use volume attach_status instead of status

References:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-ItemType-EbsInstanceBlockDeviceMappingResponseType.html

Resolves bug 1165973.

Change-Id: Ib68397b79f63e01e92ed4bebbc245ba5e0a3ad11
(cherry picked from commit f48a2e1a68cca1ef147279b2ddf713635f494bc0)

commit_message:
Adds instance root disk size checks during resize

Fixes bug: #1163844

The Hyper-V driver does not support disk resizes to a smaller size.
This patch verifies the disk size compatibility before the migration
starts in order to avoid data losses.

Change-Id: Ie99bf8779d583e97b911c9a136cee1bca9a1ecdc

subject: Use webtest for tests and reorganise.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-05-08 06:59:35.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/test.py', 'tests/backend/test_memcache.py', 'tests/v2/__init__.py', 'tests/v3/test_auth.py', 'tests/backend/test_templated.py', 'tests/backend/test_kvs.py', 'tests/server/test_ssl.py', 'tests/v3/__init__.py', 'tests/test_content_types.py', 'tests/v2/test_catalog.py', 'tests/client/__init__.py', 'tests/client/test_essex.py', 'tests/v2/base_v2.py', 'tests/v2/v2_tests.py', 'tests/v3/test_policy.py', 'keystone/service.py', 'tests/client/test_master.py', 'tests/backend/test_sql.py', 'tests/v3/base_v3.py', 'tests/backend/test_helpers.py', 'tests/backend/test_ldap.py', 'tests/backend/__init__.py', 'tests/backend/test_pam.py', 'tests/v3/test_protection.py', 'tests/backend/trust_tests.py', 'tests/backend/policy_tests.py', 'tests/client/test_kc11.py', 'tests/v3/test_catalog.py', 'tests/server/__init__.py', 'tests/server/base_server.py', 'tests/backend/token_tests.py', 'tests/v3/test_identity.py', 'tests/server/test_ipv6.py', 'tests/v2/test_json.py', 'tests/backend/identity_tests.py', 'tests/backend/base_backend.py', 'tests/test_versions.py', 'tests/client/client_tests.py', 'tests/backend/catalog_tests.py', 'tests/client/base_client.py', 'tests/client/test_sql.py', 'tests/v2/test_xml.py'], 'message': "Use webtest for tests and reorganise.

Replace starting an eventlet server for every API call with webtest
requests. The intention for the moment is not to increase speed but to
limit the dependency of our tests on eventlet. Currently the client/ and
server/ tests are the only ones running against an active server.

Group related API tests into modules.

The naming structure I've tried for is:
    tests/{name}/ - A group of related tests for a component.
    tests/{name}/base_{name}.py - Common functionality for tests.
    tests/{name}/{str}_tests.py - A group of tests related to {str} that
        aren't runnable but should be included in specific backend test cases.
    tests/{name}/test_{str}.py - A set of runnable test cases for target {str}.

In writing tests the primary change for API tests is that the
response.body is now the string body and response.result is the parsed
dictionary. This is a restriction of webob/webtest.

Change-Id: I059ddf2a26fd5f072ced70faf516185b8e51184c
"}]
commit_message:
Use webtest for tests and reorganise.

Replace starting an eventlet server for every API call with webtest
requests. The intention for the moment is not to increase speed but to
limit the dependency of our tests on eventlet. Currently the client/ and
server/ tests are the only ones running against an active server.

Group related API tests into modules.

The naming structure I've tried for is:
    tests/{name}/ - A group of related tests for a component.
    tests/{name}/base_{name}.py - Common functionality for tests.
    tests/{name}/{str}_tests.py - A group of tests related to {str} that
        aren't runnable but should be included in specific backend test cases.
    tests/{name}/test_{str}.py - A set of runnable test cases for target {str}.

In writing tests the primary change for API tests is that the
response.body is now the string body and response.result is the parsed
dictionary. This is a restriction of webob/webtest.

Change-Id: I059ddf2a26fd5f072ced70faf516185b8e51184c

subject: Retry losetup -d for up to 10 seconds.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-09 23:08:29.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create', 'lib/common-functions'], 'message': 'Retry losetup -d for up to 10 seconds.

When partition tables are added to loopback devices, this can set off a
chain of udev hooks that may still be holding the loopback open. Failing
to detach loopback devices was the reason we were seeing leaked tmpfs
volumes.

Fixes bug #1178091

Change-Id: I836d6e2bbce824951dd4786e3ef28273ea18ee73
'}]
commit_message:
Retry losetup -d for up to 10 seconds.

When partition tables are added to loopback devices, this can set off a
chain of udev hooks that may still be holding the loopback open. Failing
to detach loopback devices was the reason we were seeing leaked tmpfs
volumes.

Fixes bug #1178091

Change-Id: I836d6e2bbce824951dd4786e3ef28273ea18ee73

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2013-04-25 09:35:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_xenapi.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/volumeops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/xenapi/test_volumeops.py', 'plugins/xenserver/xenapi/contrib/rpmbuild/SPECS/openstack-xen-plugins.spec', 'nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py', 'plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/config_file', 'nova/tests/virt/xenapi/test_vmops.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Enable live block migration when using iSCSI volumes

Fix for bug 1160323.

DocImpact
Depends on a version of XAPI supporting relax-xsm-sr-check.
Currently no release versions support this, so the change at
https://github.com/xen-org/xen-api/pull/1116 would need to be applied
to the source to enable this.  XenServer 6.2 is expected to
support this mode, and possibly some future hotfixes for XenServer 6.1.

It also depends on a configuration change which must be documented and added to devstack:
* Set "relax-xsm-sr-check = true" in /etc/xapi.conf

This commit makes the following changes:
* Attach the SR on the destination host prior to migrate
* Returns the SR-ref from the pre_migrate call (API change)
* Populates the XS VDI map with the sr-ref on the destination host
* Removes the connection to the SR from the source host post-migrate
* Added plugin to determine if iSCSI block migration is enabled

Associated tempest test at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26478/

Change-Id: I917d9cf094190d636f4b9e14f6c8e728ff85af0e
Fixes: bug 1160323
'}]
commit_message:
Enable live block migration when using iSCSI volumes

Fix for bug 1160323.

DocImpact
Depends on a version of XAPI supporting relax-xsm-sr-check.
Currently no release versions support this, so the change at
https://github.com/xen-org/xen-api/pull/1116 would need to be applied
to the source to enable this.  XenServer 6.2 is expected to
support this mode, and possibly some future hotfixes for XenServer 6.1.

It also depends on a configuration change which must be documented and added to devstack:
* Set "relax-xsm-sr-check = true" in /etc/xapi.conf

This commit makes the following changes:
* Attach the SR on the destination host prior to migrate
* Returns the SR-ref from the pre_migrate call (API change)
* Populates the XS VDI map with the sr-ref on the destination host
* Removes the connection to the SR from the source host post-migrate
* Added plugin to determine if iSCSI block migration is enabled

Associated tempest test at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26478/

Change-Id: I917d9cf094190d636f4b9e14f6c8e728ff85af0e
Fixes: bug 1160323

commit_message:
Ensure default flavor is set when upgrading tempest

Add DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE to upgrade tempest to ensure this is
set. This avoids recreation of existing flavors when upgrading
tempest.

Change-Id: If2e872132939faa4b8afc8dc9b7d7d9aeb026c96
Fix: Bug 1178028

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-05-09 19:38:31.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_quantum_plugin.py', 'quantum/common/exceptions.py', 'quantum/plugins/common/utils.py', 'quantum/plugins/hyperv/hyperv_quantum_plugin.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/test_common_utils.py', 'quantum/plugins/linuxbridge/lb_quantum_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Create a common function for method _parse_network_vlan_ranges used
by plugins.

The _parse_network_vlan_ranges method does the same thing for the
linuxbridge, ovs, and hyperv plugins. Create a common function for
the plugins to use instead. This paves the way for improving vlan
range verification (see #1169266) in one place.

Fixes Bug #1177428

Change-Id: Ie8c20807e9146dd9c8bc011dd3a4dc10ec871e0b
'}]
commit_message:
Create a common function for method _parse_network_vlan_ranges used
by plugins.

The _parse_network_vlan_ranges method does the same thing for the
linuxbridge, ovs, and hyperv plugins. Create a common function for
the plugins to use instead. This paves the way for improving vlan
range verification (see #1169266) in one place.

Fixes Bug #1177428

Change-Id: Ie8c20807e9146dd9c8bc011dd3a4dc10ec871e0b

commit_message:
Improve checking of return values for functions in linuxbridge agent plugin

Fixes bug 1167780

Changed return values for some ensure_* functions to make them more consistent.
Now all ensure_* functions return None on failure and return the entity that was
created within the function when successful. Made changes to the unit tests to
reflect the changed return values.

Change-Id: Ib015ee7cee50bae5d91a4e109e7381519c1e14f7

Migration 152 changed other tables' deleted column from boolean
to integer, but cells got missed.  SQLite and MySQL are weakly-
typed enough that mixing integers and booleans is allowed, but
PostgreSQL is not, and this causes an error.

Migration 179 is a copy of migration 152, except applied only to
the cells table.

Change-Id: I85c39765edc206d38d21827ab54e1371155b9557
"}]
commit_message:
Change type of cells.deleted from boolean to integer.

Fixes bug #1168490

Migration 152 changed other tables' deleted column from boolean
to integer, but cells got missed.  SQLite and MySQL are weakly-
typed enough that mixing integers and booleans is allowed, but
PostgreSQL is not, and this causes an error.

Migration 179 is a copy of migration 152, except applied only to
the cells table.

Change-Id: I85c39765edc206d38d21827ab54e1371155b9557

commit_message:
Allow missing tags in templates.

Previously missing_tags was set to 'strict', so any missing values in
the configuration json would be flagged as an error. They will now be
ignored and returned as u'', per the pystache documentation.

Change-Id: I46d675bdd76948238191be92f0a2162963fcc478

This patch allows the ability for user password to be updated via a command prompt so the password doesnt show up in the bash history. The prompted password is asked twice to verify the match. If user cntl-D's the prompt a message appears suggesting user to use either of the options to update the password.

Change-Id: I439604f9c858aa022607e22d32a24cc6b99d42dd
Fixes: bug#938315
"}]
commit_message:
Allow secure user password update.

This patch allows the ability for user password to be updated via a command prompt so the password doesnt show up in the bash history. The prompted password is asked twice to verify the match. If user cntl-D's the prompt a message appears suggesting user to use either of the options to update the password.

Change-Id: I439604f9c858aa022607e22d32a24cc6b99d42dd
Fixes: bug#938315

commit_message:
Adds metadata_listen parameter

Previously, metadata_listen used the api_bind_address
parameter, but there are scenarios when it should listen on another
IP address, such as localhost - for example, when using Quantum
metadata.

Change-Id: I8b1b2d8623a0626516342f7750eecb3087e8a880

commit_message:
Controller and API changes for backups.

-API controller for backups
-adding swift url to the config
-Fixing failing tests
-Renaming 'instance' param.
 Checking for NotFound models so that the returned error is friendly
-adding feature to list all backups from a specific instance
-Adding checks for creating/deleting/restoring backups when it is not completed
-Adding unit tests for backup controller
-adding check to see if file is in swift
-Adding skeleton code for delete backup in the task manager
-Fixed backups API to pass in the backup_id during create_backup.
-adding int tests for backup controller
-Adding backup list and delete int tests
-Adding list backups for instance test
-Adding quota for create backup

BP: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/reddwarf/+spec/consistent-snapshots

Change-Id: I35c2fefcce4b3009e76ba7232c52dabf502a3ac0

commit_message:
in dhcp_agent, always use quantum.conf root_helper

Fixes bug #1178003.

For the most part, the dhcp agent uses the root_helper setting from the [AGENT]
section of /etc/quantum/quantum.conf. However, in a couple of spots, the
root_helper setting from the [DEFAULT] section of /etc/quantum/dhcp_agent.ini
was being used.

Change-Id: Id2f3140374a705cf7a0d2a784e4f321cc54f602e

commit_message:
Set MYSQL_HOST parameter to better support multi-node mode.

When deploying openstack with multi-node mode,
mysql needs to be started by listening it's real ip, not localhost.
but devstack always use localhost to recreate databases that will
lead bellow errors.

Fix bug 1177735

Change-Id: I50284f469a998d023a41b4796f1dc775bb52e710

subject: Do not test foreign keys with SQLite version < 3.7
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 2284, 'name': 'Eoghan Glynn', 'email': 'eglynn@redhat.com', 'username': 'eglynn'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-06 17:45:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_db_api.py'], 'message': "Do not test foreign keys with SQLite version < 3.7

Fixes bug 1158828

Even though SQLAlchemy is documented to support foreign keys (with
the pragma set) on SQLite >= 3.6.19, we're seeing consistent problems
with that support on RHEL 6.4 with SQLite 3.6.20.  It works fine on
Fedora and Ubuntu with SQLite 3.7.x.

To work around these problems, if we're using SQLite, test the SQLite
version inside the test that requires foreign key support,
and skip the test if it's < 3.7

Change-Id: I1c26f29371376b271a4e384ea7b5d2009651acc1
"}]
commit_message:
Do not test foreign keys with SQLite version < 3.7

Fixes bug 1158828

Even though SQLAlchemy is documented to support foreign keys (with
the pragma set) on SQLite >= 3.6.19, we're seeing consistent problems
with that support on RHEL 6.4 with SQLite 3.6.20.  It works fine on
Fedora and Ubuntu with SQLite 3.7.x.

To work around these problems, if we're using SQLite, test the SQLite
version inside the test that requires foreign key support,
and skip the test if it's < 3.7

Change-Id: I1c26f29371376b271a4e384ea7b5d2009651acc1

commit_message:
Create image api does not show all required or optional attributes.

"name" and "metadata" only occurs in the example,
but they are not specified in the "Request parameters" section.
there is no doc to indicate that if them are required or optional.

Fix bug 1158134

Change-Id: Iacf6df91e4633a32a2c6b31b9d3d660299ad800a

subject: refactor: Hoist helpers.expect into package namespace
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-07 22:03:48.000000000', 'files': ['marconi/tests/test_config.py', 'marconi/tests/util/__init__.py', 'HACKING.rst', 'marconi/tests/storage/base.py', 'marconi/tests/util/helpers.py'], 'message': "refactor: Hoist helpers.expect into package namespace

It's silly to have to import a package's submodule directly,
since in this case that only introduces another module name
that the developer has to keep track of, just to gain access
to a solitary function. This patch hoists
marconi.tests.util.helpers.expect into marocni.tests.util so
that it can be referenced more naturally by the test author.

Accordingly, the Hacking.rst guide has been updated to allow
this sort of thing (with some discretion).

Implements: blueprint grizzly-debt
Change-Id: Iad2e4f728aa4826d99bec2c599e2947a87eb5945
"}]
commit_message:
refactor: Hoist helpers.expect into package namespace

It's silly to have to import a package's submodule directly,
since in this case that only introduces another module name
that the developer has to keep track of, just to gain access
to a solitary function. This patch hoists
marconi.tests.util.helpers.expect into marocni.tests.util so
that it can be referenced more naturally by the test author.

Accordingly, the Hacking.rst guide has been updated to allow
this sort of thing (with some discretion).

Implements: blueprint grizzly-debt
Change-Id: Iad2e4f728aa4826d99bec2c599e2947a87eb5945

subject: Changes to Nova for Quantum
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-09 03:44:14.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/network.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_network_quantum_spec.rb', 'manifests/network/quantum.pp'], 'message': 'Changes to Nova for Quantum

This patch removes Quantum as an option in network.pp. If using
Quantum, just directly use nova::network::quantum instead. This
patch also enables Nova to be configured to use Quantum security
groups.

Change-Id: I162f1c5153f10150ac4997d31d3b50b702daf013
'}]
commit_message:
Changes to Nova for Quantum

This patch removes Quantum as an option in network.pp. If using
Quantum, just directly use nova::network::quantum instead. This
patch also enables Nova to be configured to use Quantum security
groups.

Change-Id: I162f1c5153f10150ac4997d31d3b50b702daf013

subject: Remove insecure default for signing_dir option.
revisions:

The sample api-paste.ini file included an insecure value for the
signing_dir option for the keystone authtoken middleware.  Comment out
the option so that we just rely on the default behavior by default.

Fix bug 1174608.

Change-Id: I6189788953d789c34456bbe150b8ed6ce6f68403
(cherry picked from commit 58d6879b1caaa750c39c8e452a0634c24ffef2ce)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove insecure default for signing_dir option.

The sample api-paste.ini file included an insecure value for the
signing_dir option for the keystone authtoken middleware.  Comment out
the option so that we just rely on the default behavior by default.

Fix bug 1174608.

Change-Id: I6189788953d789c34456bbe150b8ed6ce6f68403
(cherry picked from commit 58d6879b1caaa750c39c8e452a0634c24ffef2ce)

subject: Bug # 1156429 - Correct placement of auth=no setting for Qpid.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-08 02:41:09.000000000', 'files': ['doc/src/docbkx/openstack-install/installing-rabbitmq.xml', 'doc/src/docbkx/openstack-install/installing-mysql.xml', 'doc/src/docbkx/openstack-install/samples/nova.conf-yum', 'doc/src/docbkx/openstack-install/compute-config-guest-network.xml'], 'message': 'Bug # 1156429 - Correct placement of auth=no setting for Qpid.

Removed the auth="no" setting from the section of the guide it was in
which was unrelated to messaging and assumed that Qpid would be
colocated with Nova (hence the config file being updated didn't exist
for some users).

Updated the message broker installation section to more thoroughly cover
Qpid installation and set up and added missing rpc_backend directive to
the example nova.conf file for the "yum" version of the book. Also fixed
an errant prompt character in the installing MySQL material (s/$/#/)
because the introduction tells the user that the commands within the
section need to be run as root.

Change-Id: I89df0d1050c6871254001e560a45ea6189bbfe18
'}]
commit_message:
Bug # 1156429 - Correct placement of auth=no setting for Qpid.

Removed the auth="no" setting from the section of the guide it was in
which was unrelated to messaging and assumed that Qpid would be
colocated with Nova (hence the config file being updated didn't exist
for some users).

Updated the message broker installation section to more thoroughly cover
Qpid installation and set up and added missing rpc_backend directive to
the example nova.conf file for the "yum" version of the book. Also fixed
an errant prompt character in the installing MySQL material (s/$/#/)
because the introduction tells the user that the commands within the
section need to be run as root.

Change-Id: I89df0d1050c6871254001e560a45ea6189bbfe18

commit_message:
added cell_name to admin api call for server as separate extension

Add an extension to Server API to return the cellName of a server.
This needs to be a different extension than existing server extension,
so that only interested parties can enable this.

Implements: blueprint cellname-servers-api
Change-Id: Ibcac1c5977fec3b03f389fafca264f3c98099cf4

commit_message:
Copy the RHEL6 eventlet workaround from Oslo

Tests in oslo-incubator now need the horrendous hack to workaround an
issue with eventlet on RHEL6. We've moved the patch_tox_venv tool
and redhat-eventlet.patch into oslo-incubator, so add them to
openstack-common.conf.

Change-Id: I1acfec282b64d7582144b155119bedb1741db2f7

subject: Refactor of puppet-quantum
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-09 01:14:52.000000000', 'files': ['files/rootwrap.conf', 'manifests/agents/ovs.pp', 'manifests/init.pp', 'README.md', 'examples/install_sample.sh', 'manifests/plugins/ovs/port.pp', 'manifests/agents/l3.pp', 'spec/classes/quantum_server_spec.rb', 'files/qemu.conf', 'manifests/params.pp', 'manifests/client.pp', 'manifests/plugins/ovs.pp', 'examples/quantum.pp', 'manifests/plugins/ovs/bridge.pp', 'manifests/server.pp', 'manifests/db/host_access.pp', 'manifests/keystone/auth.pp', 'spec/classes/quantum_init_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Refactor of puppet-quantum

This commit introduces several changes to the quantum puppet module:

  * Rewrites the README.md file
  * Fixes the example manifest
  * Adds examples/create_network.sh as a quick helper script until
    proper types/providers are made.
  * Removes rootwrap.conf. This should be packaged by the distribution.
  * Removes the qemu.conf file from manifests/init.pp. This is not the
    right place for this file and packaging a full qemu.conf file into
    this module is not a good idea.
  * Renames two variables in params.pp to something more intuitive.
  * Renames auth_password to keystone_password in manifests/server.pp
    as this is the naming scheme used in other modules.
  * Fixes tenant specification in keystone/auth.pp
  * Removes UUIDs specified in agents/l3.pp
  * Adds external bridge creation in agents/l3.pp
  * Adds metadata_ip to agents/l3.pp
  * Adds firewall support in manifests/agents/ovs.pp
  * Lots of formatting and restructuring

Change-Id: Ifc4325f7d472a3fd78f7b379b5095b974874909b
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor of puppet-quantum

This commit introduces several changes to the quantum puppet module:

  * Rewrites the README.md file
  * Fixes the example manifest
  * Adds examples/create_network.sh as a quick helper script until
    proper types/providers are made.
  * Removes rootwrap.conf. This should be packaged by the distribution.
  * Removes the qemu.conf file from manifests/init.pp. This is not the
    right place for this file and packaging a full qemu.conf file into
    this module is not a good idea.
  * Renames two variables in params.pp to something more intuitive.
  * Renames auth_password to keystone_password in manifests/server.pp
    as this is the naming scheme used in other modules.
  * Fixes tenant specification in keystone/auth.pp
  * Removes UUIDs specified in agents/l3.pp
  * Adds external bridge creation in agents/l3.pp
  * Adds metadata_ip to agents/l3.pp
  * Adds firewall support in manifests/agents/ovs.pp
  * Lots of formatting and restructuring

Change-Id: Ifc4325f7d472a3fd78f7b379b5095b974874909b

commit_message:
Changes the OVS plugin/agent

This patch makes the following changes to the OVS plugin/agent:

  * Adds doc heads
  * Adds firewall driver support
  * Allows GRE to be setup without VLANs
  * Renames the plugin package to a more intuitive name
  * General format/code cleanup

Change-Id: I96080171a9b6e252510ce62351db98926f754c31

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-05-08 23:35:03.000000000', 'files': ['elements/heat-cfntools/os-config-applier/etc/cfn/hooks.conf', 'elements/os-refresh-config/install.d/75-cfn-hup-cronjob', 'elements/os-refresh-config/install.d/cfn-hup-wrapper'], 'message': "Run cfn-hup via a cron job.

cfn-hup is supposed to be a daemon, but it doesn't work that way. So run
it via a wrapper in a cron job. Also run this way, we won't have
logging, so make sure os-refresh-config is run via upstart so we get the

Change-Id: I8613c45b33091ad6448ecddebe6a1f4337f09d7d
"}]
commit_message:
Run cfn-hup via a cron job.

cfn-hup is supposed to be a daemon, but it doesn't work that way. So run
it via a wrapper in a cron job. Also run this way, we won't have
logging, so make sure os-refresh-config is run via upstart so we get the
output logged.

The wrapper must use a lock to avoid problems that might be caused when
multiple updates overlap.

Change-Id: I8613c45b33091ad6448ecddebe6a1f4337f09d7d

subject: Force the inclusion of /usr/local/bin in PATH.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-05-08 22:38:52.000000000', 'files': ['lib/img-functions'], 'message': "Force the inclusion of /usr/local/bin in PATH.

Sudo compiled with the --with-secure-path option enabled (default on
Ubuntu, Fedora and potentially other distros) will cause sudo to ignore
any changes made to the PATH variable in the user's environment (even when
the -E option is used). Also, some distros might not have /usr/local/bin
set in their sudoers secure_path causing the diskimage-builder to fail
when building an image using such distros as host. This patch will force
the inclusion of the /usr/local/bin in the PATH enviroment variable
inside the chroot.

Change-Id: Idb7156d8ff124bfe685cc721337d9bb21f49dc9e
Fixes: bug #1175980
"}]
commit_message:
Force the inclusion of /usr/local/bin in PATH.

Sudo compiled with the --with-secure-path option enabled (default on
Ubuntu, Fedora and potentially other distros) will cause sudo to ignore
any changes made to the PATH variable in the user's environment (even when
the -E option is used). Also, some distros might not have /usr/local/bin
set in their sudoers secure_path causing the diskimage-builder to fail
when building an image using such distros as host. This patch will force
the inclusion of the /usr/local/bin in the PATH enviroment variable
inside the chroot.

Change-Id: Idb7156d8ff124bfe685cc721337d9bb21f49dc9e
Fixes: bug #1175980

Currently when creates subnet with /32 cidr, allocation pool
and gateway are set incorrect. For /32 cidr, DHCP should be

Change-Id: Ifbdad9a2187c9cfcc88380e812f384566151d424
Fixes: bug #1177196
'}]
commit_message:
Fix /32 subnet creation to work properly

Currently when creates subnet with /32 cidr, allocation pool
and gateway are set incorrect. For /32 cidr, DHCP should be
disabled and gateway should be set None.

Change-Id: Ifbdad9a2187c9cfcc88380e812f384566151d424

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-08 13:17:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Session cleanup for db.floating_ip_* methods

Session objects shouldn't be used in public db.api methods
because db.api should be independent of db implementation.

Remove session parameter from:
  floating_ip_create
  floating_ip_get_by_fixed_ip_id

I didn't remove session parameter from floating_ip_count_by_project
because it causes changes in nova.quota. So it will be done in
separated patch.

Cleanup test for floating_ip_count_by_project removed 3rd
parameter (it should be session, but it is not required).

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Ifdf9edb17746a8e5b486317c917ea69016a2b99d
"}]
commit_message:
Session cleanup for db.floating_ip_* methods

Session objects shouldn't be used in public db.api methods
because db.api should be independent of db implementation.

Remove session parameter from:
  floating_ip_create
  floating_ip_get_by_fixed_ip_id

I didn't remove session parameter from floating_ip_count_by_project
because it causes changes in nova.quota. So it will be done in
separated patch.

Cleanup test for floating_ip_count_by_project removed 3rd
parameter (it should be session, but it is not required).

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Ifdf9edb17746a8e5b486317c917ea69016a2b99d

subject: Remove stack trace logs from fault message
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 177, 'name': 'Alex Meade', 'email': 'mr.alex.meade@gmail.com', 'username': 'alex-meade'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 6999, 'name': 'Phong Doan Ly', 'email': 'phongdly@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'phongdly'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-07 06:40:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/utils.py'], 'message': 'Remove stack trace logs from fault message

In case of Nova fails to deploy an image, when user run
cli command like "nova show image-name" it will show the
exception class name, the detail message that is thrown from
the exception class, and also the stack trace logs.

End-user does not need to see the stack trace logs, this should be
seen in nova compute log files.

This fix will remove the stack trace logs from fault message.

Fixes bug 1177205

Change-Id: I39323beef69485a1c37e5a46fb448a292d9941e0
'}]
commit_message:
Remove stack trace logs from fault message

In case of Nova fails to deploy an image, when user run
cli command like "nova show image-name" it will show the
exception class name, the detail message that is thrown from
the exception class, and also the stack trace logs.

End-user does not need to see the stack trace logs, this should be
seen in nova compute log files.

This fix will remove the stack trace logs from fault message.

Fixes bug 1177205

Change-Id: I39323beef69485a1c37e5a46fb448a292d9941e0

subject: Remove img-functions from ramdisk-image-create.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-05-08 19:51:32.000000000', 'files': ['lib/img-functions', 'bin/ramdisk-image-create', 'lib/common-functions'], 'message': 'Remove img-functions from ramdisk-image-create.

Ramdisk-image-create sources both img-functions and ramdisk-functions
causing duplicate functions. To correct this situation this patch
removes the import of img-functions from ramdisk-image-create.
It moves cleanup_dirs and run_d functions from img-functions to
common-functions to allow this.

fixes bug 1175427
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I971d019b0d92b06d9de661663b49c433e823ea42
'}]
commit_message:
Remove img-functions from ramdisk-image-create.

Ramdisk-image-create sources both img-functions and ramdisk-functions
causing duplicate functions. To correct this situation this patch
removes the import of img-functions from ramdisk-image-create.
It moves cleanup_dirs and run_d functions from img-functions to
common-functions to allow this.

fixes bug 1175427
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I971d019b0d92b06d9de661663b49c433e823ea42

subject: Ignore errors when ldd'ing static binaries.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-08 19:50:50.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ramdisk-functions'], 'message': "Ignore errors when ldd'ing static binaries.

When trying to get the library dependencies from a static program
it fails and die.
This scapes the error and continue with the execution.

Change-Id: Id3463f2dd77a182ce4f9d9d28165d35f17806892
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore errors when ldd'ing static binaries.

When trying to get the library dependencies from a static program
it fails and die.
This scapes the error and continue with the execution.

Change-Id: Id3463f2dd77a182ce4f9d9d28165d35f17806892

commit_message:
Remove insecure default for signing_dir option.

The sample api-paste.ini file included an insecure value for the
signing_dir option for the keystone authtoken middleware.  Comment out
the option so that we just rely on the default behavior by default.

Fix bug 1174608.

Change-Id: I6189788953d789c34456bbe150b8ed6ce6f68403

commit_message:
Remove insecure default for signing_dir option.

The sample api-paste.ini file included an insecure value for the
signing_dir option for the keystone authtoken middleware.  Comment out
the option so that we just rely on the default behavior by default.

Fix bug 1174608.

Conflicts:
	etc/nova/api-paste.ini

Change-Id: I6189788953d789c34456bbe150b8ed6ce6f68403
(cherry picked from commit 58d6879b1caaa750c39c8e452a0634c24ffef2ce)

commit_message:
Copy the RHEL6 eventlet workaround from Oslo

Tests in oslo-incubator now need the horrendous hack to workaround an
issue with eventlet on RHEL6. We've moved the patch_tox_venv tool
and redhat-eventlet.patch into oslo-incubator, so add them to
openstack-common.conf.

Change-Id: I1acfec282b64d7582144b155119bedb1741db2f7

commit_message:
Fix test_mismatched_X test data deletion check

The assertion checking if data for an image is deleted correctly will
always pass. This is because it was using only the name of the file instead of
the absolute path.

Fixes bug 1177818

Introduces a mechanism for switching between API versions,
and implements it in a proof-of-concept fashion for the
Keystone v3 API. Converts the existing Users and Projects
API methods to use it.

This changed some method signatures, and therefore altered
a number of views and tests. However, all code related to
the version cahnges is contained in the api.keystone module.
This seems like a sane process going forwards.

Future TODOs are marked in the code, including auto-detection
of API versions and better endpoint URL construction.

Partially implements blueprint api-capability-detection

Change-Id: Ied04200fe6c257aac2241d36628965a3bb6658b9
'}]
commit_message:
Enable using multiple API versions for Identity Service.

Introduces a mechanism for switching between API versions,
and implements it in a proof-of-concept fashion for the
Keystone v3 API. Converts the existing Users and Projects
API methods to use it.

This changed some method signatures, and therefore altered
a number of views and tests. However, all code related to
the version cahnges is contained in the api.keystone module.
This seems like a sane process going forwards.

Future TODOs are marked in the code, including auto-detection
of API versions and better endpoint URL construction.

Partially implements blueprint api-capability-detection

Change-Id: Ied04200fe6c257aac2241d36628965a3bb6658b9

commit_message:
Fix ability to add custom volume_backend_name

This patch fixes the ability to set the volume_backend_name
for each driver.   The original bug was filed against LeftHand
and 3PAR, but several drivers exhibited a fixed backend name.

Fixes: bug #1175222
       bug #1172286

Change-Id: I4197f99bebd6ca8e4969795ae6edb537bc066c90
(cherry picked from commit 54a2ee48a4dc31cbf116b1e9d5add37efe66bc20)

commit_message:
Add db client packages to dev env setup doc.

Dev env setup doc hasn't been updated in a while and
needed the addition of the mysql and psql packages.

Tested this on a clean install and it looks like
the addition of these two pkgs should get us up to
date.

commit_message:
Rename nova.compute.instance_types to flavors

First step in removing references to instance_types. Rename instnace_types.py
and update references to it. We currently use instance_type and flavor as
synonyms, to reduce confusion we are picking one. We are going with our own
terminology, flavors.

renamed:    nova/compute/instance_types.py -> nova/compute/flavors.py

Partially implements bp flavor-instance-type-dedup

Change-Id: I9dc04cf311aa8813be4f5329f23729d2c43cae6d

subject: Import recent rootwrap features in local rootwrap
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-05-08 15:18:27.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/rootwrap/filters.py', 'bin/quantum-rootwrap', 'quantum/rootwrap/wrapper.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/test_rootwrap.py'], 'message': 'Import recent rootwrap features in local rootwrap

Import features developed in oslo-rootwrap during the Grizzly cycle (and
recently in havana) into quantum-rootwrap. This is the first step toward
using the common oslo-rootwrap into Quantum: the goal being to make both
implementations converge, we should avoid making local changes (and push
any required change into oslo-rootwrap instead from now on).

New features include:
- Optional logging (use_syslog)
- Searching for executables in a specified binary path (exec_dirs)
- New path-based PathFilter

Those features required a refactoring in the way executables are matched
and in configuration loading.

Implements bp quantum-rootwrap-new-features

Change-Id: Ia6a2e91c297ade471448dae0964adfd001a46086
'}]
commit_message:
Import recent rootwrap features in local rootwrap

Import features developed in oslo-rootwrap during the Grizzly cycle (and
recently in havana) into quantum-rootwrap. This is the first step toward
using the common oslo-rootwrap into Quantum: the goal being to make both
implementations converge, we should avoid making local changes (and push
any required change into oslo-rootwrap instead from now on).

New features include:
- Optional logging (use_syslog)
- Searching for executables in a specified binary path (exec_dirs)
- New path-based PathFilter

Those features required a refactoring in the way executables are matched
and in configuration loading.

Implements bp quantum-rootwrap-new-features

Change-Id: Ia6a2e91c297ade471448dae0964adfd001a46086

commit_message:
Add affinity availability zone scheduler filter

Create an new filter to schedule the instance on a same/different availability
zone of a set of instances. And add some tests for the filter.

Since get instance availability zone code is need by many modules, so move it
into utils module nova.avalability_zones. And add some tests for the new
method.

Implemented bp: different-availability-zone-filter

Change-Id: Icee1db0db383a45bfec95209965725e522e90679

test_template_format is different from all other tests, in that
we don't want to use the most minimal template possible, we
actually want to test conversion works with maximal/non-trivial
templates, so copy the two templates used by this test into a

Change-Id: Ib5421545103728385992625884f86f2667ee2465

commit_message:
tests : convert test_template_format to test-local templates

test_template_format is different from all other tests, in that
we don't want to use the most minimal template possible, we
actually want to test conversion works with maximal/non-trivial
templates, so copy the two templates used by this test into a
local tests/templates directory, with a README caution that
in general inline-minimal templates are preferred.

Change-Id: Ib5421545103728385992625884f86f2667ee2465

commit_message:
Expanding the case of InstanceNotFound exception in get-vnc-console.

Up until now, asking for vnc console of an instance in ERROR status
would lead to InstanceNotReady exception which gets the driver's
instance name as a parameter, however, KeyError would be thrown
because this name is None. This case now will be part of the
InstanceNotFound exception.

Fixes bug 1175776

Change-Id: Id08707e6700fa684ad90af5b792e1397e2047203

subject: Avoid using nosetests --tests config option
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-08 08:40:47.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Avoid using nosetests --tests config option

Previously, it was possible to do:

  $> tox -- glance.tests.foo glance.tests.bar

but since we started using tests=glance/tests in setup.cfg[1] you must
now do this:

  $> tox -- --tests glance.tests.foo,glance.tests.bar

because positional args are appended to the value of --tests in the
config file, so you must override it with --tests on the command line.

Use nose's runmodule() API which allows us to set defaultTest to
glance/tests - this acts as a default value where no positional args
are supplied and restores the original behaviour.

[1]- to avoid having nose load code outside glance/tests and fail
because the _() builtin isn't installed

Change-Id: I6c701b09bf02d22c9dfac4a27ebe15c8d5ab631c
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid using nosetests --tests config option

Previously, it was possible to do:

  $> tox -- glance.tests.foo glance.tests.bar

but since we started using tests=glance/tests in setup.cfg[1] you must
now do this:

  $> tox -- --tests glance.tests.foo,glance.tests.bar

because positional args are appended to the value of --tests in the
config file, so you must override it with --tests on the command line.

Use nose's runmodule() API which allows us to set defaultTest to
glance/tests - this acts as a default value where no positional args
are supplied and restores the original behaviour.

[1]- to avoid having nose load code outside glance/tests and fail
because the _() builtin isn't installed

Change-Id: I6c701b09bf02d22c9dfac4a27ebe15c8d5ab631c

Upstream cloud images likely have console=ttyS0 embedded in the kernel

commit_message:
Add element to remove serial console.

Upstream cloud images likely have console=ttyS0 embedded in the kernel
commandline portion of the GRUB config. This makes local, direct testing
of the images substantially more difficult because upstart is writing
its output to a console that isn't being monitored.
This element simply removes console=ttyS0 from the grub configuration.

Change-Id: I07429bb504b467634071cc31ef184af730bbb5d6

commit_message:
Add libz-dev to os-svc-install to fix raring.

Before Ubuntu 13.04 libz-dev was pulled in as a dependency of the other
libraries mentioned here, but 13.04 changed the graph. Lxml and possibly
other modules link against libz during the pip install phase.

commit_message:
Remove tripleo PPA from base element.

The PPA would have to be updated for each release we want to build for,
including raring. The PPA also gives the tripleo team root on every
built image, something we don't necessarily want.

A shallow review of the packages in the PPA and known elements shows
only one dependency in the tripleo-image-elements heat-cfntools element.

Change-Id: Ic514f929eba26014dd3a0d76d5bb3b8e9e0caf3c

subject: Example alternate fix for atomic transactions
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-04-25 20:44:19.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/backends/kvs.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/sql.py', 'keystone/identity/controllers.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/ldap/core.py', 'tests/test_keystoneclient.py'], 'message': 'Example alternate fix for atomic transactions

This patch shows an alternate way of fixing the atomic
identity modifications to allow drivers that are capable
of transactions to implement them as needed.

Basically, this required pulling code calls out of the
controller layer and into the underlying drivers. The
pattern to follow to allow transactional drivers to issue
appropriate session handling is to ensure each main
"entry point" on the controller only issues calls to the
drivers that return information (for instance, to check
if something exists when trying to delete or add) and
only a single driver call that modifies data. Let the drivers
themselves call other driver methods if need be, ensuring
that outer transactions can be contained, if the driver
supports it.

This patch just shows the create_user() example. Clearly
each controller method would need to be examined to ensure
only a single data-modifying call is made in any of the
controller methods.

Partially fixes lp 1130676

Change-Id: I8631a99c5e6936d9902f28f3c38e593d245dcbd5
'}]
commit_message:
Example alternate fix for atomic transactions

This patch shows an alternate way of fixing the atomic
identity modifications to allow drivers that are capable
of transactions to implement them as needed.

Basically, this required pulling code calls out of the
controller layer and into the underlying drivers. The
pattern to follow to allow transactional drivers to issue
appropriate session handling is to ensure each main
"entry point" on the controller only issues calls to the
drivers that return information (for instance, to check
if something exists when trying to delete or add) and
only a single driver call that modifies data. Let the drivers
themselves call other driver methods if need be, ensuring
that outer transactions can be contained, if the driver
supports it.

This patch just shows the create_user() example. Clearly
each controller method would need to be examined to ensure
only a single data-modifying call is made in any of the
controller methods.

Partially fixes lp 1130676

Change-Id: I8631a99c5e6936d9902f28f3c38e593d245dcbd5

commit_message:
Added a new evacuate action to os-hosts extension

This is a PUT action on the host that would evacuate all instances on
the host to the target host specifed in the params.
Also added separate entries to the policy.json for access control.
Moved helpers like '_delete_server' and '_wait_for_deletion' from
tests/integrated/test_servers.py to
tests/integrated/integrated_helpers.py

Implements: blueprint evacuate-host
Change-Id: I986b316e86c921c247335b253887eb1ae3594c4f

commit_message:
Add common block storage library to OSLO.

Add ability to perform operations on local LVM and Disk
resources via OSLO block_storage library.  This will
start with the necessary components to replace the LVM.py
driver in Cinder (turns the driver into an interface calling
this lib).

Raw disks would be a seperate patch.

Future changes should like send things like attach code and iscsi
connect upstream to common as well as there's numerous places where
we're currently duplicating this code across projects.

Partial implementation of blueprint: shared-block-storage-library

Change-Id: Iee40a9c9290d3b3e51be1622df5d19e395099601

subject: Copy Nova's workaround for RHEL6 eventlet issue
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-05-08 05:48:33.000000000', 'files': ['MAINTAINERS', 'contrib/redhat-eventlet.patch', 'tools/patch_tox_venv.py', 'tox.ini', 'update.py'], 'message': 'Copy Nova's workaround for RHEL6 eventlet issue

The eventlet on PyPI basically doesn't work on RHEL because we (Red Hat)
screwed up by not taking monkey patching into account when backporting
an API from python 3. This is the series of events:

  1) We backported a patch to RHEL6 from Python 3 which added an
     optional 'timeout' argument to subprocess.Popen:

       http://pkgs.devel.redhat.com/cgit/rpms/python/commit/?h=rhel-6.3&id=fc9a3f0e07

     This might sound innocuous but it means the wait() function get
     called with a timeout argument

  2) eventlet overrides this function, but doesn't know about the
     timeout argument, so it fails. To reproduce, try applying this to
     your python 2.7:

       https://gist.github.com/markmc/5500967

  3) eventlet doesn't yet support Python 3, so the only time this issue
     crops up is if you use eventlet on RHEL6

  4) We've fixed eventlet in EPEL6, but the issue still remains if you
     install eventlet from upstream

  5) Dave Malcolm sent a pull request to eventlet, but it has stalled:

       https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/pull-request/30/add-dummy-timeout-parameter-to

Nova has long had a nasty workaround to patch eventlet in our virtualenv
and we now need this workaround in oslo-incubator to test processutils.
Let's add it here and make nova sync it from oslo-incubator.

I really hope we can get eventlet upstream "fixed" and the fix released
soon. When that happens, we can kill all this nastiness.

Change-Id: I62ce43a330d7ae94eda4c7498782a655e63747fa
'}]
commit_message:
Copy Nova's workaround for RHEL6 eventlet issue

The eventlet on PyPI basically doesn't work on RHEL because we (Red Hat)
screwed up by not taking monkey patching into account when backporting
an API from python 3. This is the series of events:

  1) We backported a patch to RHEL6 from Python 3 which added an
     optional 'timeout' argument to subprocess.Popen:

       http://pkgs.devel.redhat.com/cgit/rpms/python/commit/?h=rhel-6.3&id=fc9a3f0e07

     This might sound innocuous but it means the wait() function get
     called with a timeout argument

  2) eventlet overrides this function, but doesn't know about the
     timeout argument, so it fails. To reproduce, try applying this to
     your python 2.7:

       https://gist.github.com/markmc/5500967

  3) eventlet doesn't yet support Python 3, so the only time this issue
     crops up is if you use eventlet on RHEL6

  4) We've fixed eventlet in EPEL6, but the issue still remains if you
     install eventlet from upstream

  5) Dave Malcolm sent a pull request to eventlet, but it has stalled:

       https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/pull-request/30/add-dummy-timeout-parameter-to

Nova has long had a nasty workaround to patch eventlet in our virtualenv
and we now need this workaround in oslo-incubator to test processutils.
Let's add it here and make nova sync it from oslo-incubator.

I really hope we can get eventlet upstream "fixed" and the fix released
soon. When that happens, we can kill all this nastiness.

Change-Id: I62ce43a330d7ae94eda4c7498782a655e63747fa

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-07 04:44:28.000000000', 'files': ['cfn/Rails_Single_Instance.template', 'cfn/MySQL_Single_Instance.template', 'cfn/OpenShift.template', 'cfn/WordPress_2_Instances_With_EBS.template', 'cfn/HAProxy_Single_Instance.template', 'cfn/WordPress_Single_Instance_With_HA_AccessPolicy.template', 'cfn/EC2WithEBSSample.template', 'cfn/WordPress_Single_Instance_With_IHA.template', 'cfn/WordPress_Single_Instance.yaml', 'cfn/WordPress_With_RDS.template', 'cfn/WordPress_Single_Instance_puppet.template', 'cfn/getting_started.template', 'cfn/WordPress_Single_Instance_deb.template', 'cfn/WordPress_2_Instances_With_EBS_EIP.template', 'cfn/WordPress_With_LB.template', 'cfn/WordPress_Single_Instance_With_EIP.template', 'cfn/InstanceGroup.template', 'cfn/WordPress_Single_Instance_With_EBS_EIP.template', 'cfn/WordPress_And_Http.template', 'cfn/PuppetMaster_Single_Instance.template', 'cfn/WordPress_Single_Instance_gold.template', 'cfn/WordPress_Single_Instance.template', 'cfn/AutoScalingMultiAZSample.template', 'cfn/WordPress_NoKey.template', 'cfn/AutoScalingMultiAZSample.yaml', 'cfn/WordPress_2_Instances.template', 'cfn/WordPress_Composed_Instances.template', 'cfn/WordPress_Single_Instance_With_Quantum.template', 'cfn/WordPress_Single_Instance_With_HA.yaml', 'cfn/WordPress_Single_Instance_With_EBS.template', 'cfn/WordPress_Single_Instance_With_HA.template'], 'message': 'Standardize template instance types on nova defaults

Based on the following
$ nova flavor-list
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+
| ID | Name      | Memory_MB | Disk | Ephemeral | Swap | VCPUs |
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+
| 1  | m1.tiny   | 512       | 0    | 0         |      | 1
| 2  | m1.small  | 2048      | 20   | 0         |      | 1

- m1.small is specified as the Default for InstanceType parameters
  (previously this was m1.medium or m1.large. It would be better if
  there was a flavor with 1GB memory, but m1.small is the next most
  appropriate.)
- m1.tiny is the only flavor mapped to Arch=32 in AWSInstanceType2Arch
- AllowedValues and AWSInstanceType2Arch mapping is now limited to the
  following nova defaults:
  [ "m1.tiny", "m1.small", "m1.medium", "m1.large", "m1.xlarge" ]

This will allow heat/tools/nova_create_flavors.sh to be deleted.

Part of blueprint default-nova-flavors

Change-Id: Ia8bba4bd17a2d665676104fbdeb1e188b55aeeaf
'}]
commit_message:
Standardize template instance types on nova defaults

Based on the following
$ nova flavor-list
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+
| ID | Name      | Memory_MB | Disk | Ephemeral | Swap | VCPUs |
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+
| 1  | m1.tiny   | 512       | 0    | 0         |      | 1
| 2  | m1.small  | 2048      | 20   | 0         |      | 1

- m1.small is specified as the Default for InstanceType parameters
  (previously this was m1.medium or m1.large. It would be better if
  there was a flavor with 1GB memory, but m1.small is the next most
  appropriate.)
- m1.tiny is the only flavor mapped to Arch=32 in AWSInstanceType2Arch
- AllowedValues and AWSInstanceType2Arch mapping is now limited to the
  following nova defaults:
  [ "m1.tiny", "m1.small", "m1.medium", "m1.large", "m1.xlarge" ]

This will allow heat/tools/nova_create_flavors.sh to be deleted.

Part of blueprint default-nova-flavors

Change-Id: Ia8bba4bd17a2d665676104fbdeb1e188b55aeeaf

commit_message:
Run hooks even without cfn-init Metadata.

When we don't have AWS::CloudFormation::Init in Metadata, this just
means that cfn-init cannot do anything. However, cfn-hup still has hooks
which are just scheduled to be run on any change in the Metadata.

Fixes bug #1155999

Change-Id: I21c4f2137f8045128a86278b4d90768ea97455d1

commit_message:
Transition from openstack.common.setup to pbr.

Declarative approach to packaging, obviates the need for copying files.
Also, removes the need for setup.py to import files from the nova
module.

./run_tests.sh now ensure's that nova.egg-info/entry_points.txt is up to
date before running tests.

Change-Id: I7b7a18e065a62491ade54fbed5d8400db1d4e6c7

subject: libvirt: ignore NOSTATE in resume_state_on_host_boot() method.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-06 13:47:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: ignore NOSTATE in resume_state_on_host_boot() method.

Occasionally, libvirt would get NOSTATE from hypervisor as instance
state. Thus if we don't ignore instances in NOSTATE in
resume_state_on_host_boot() method, we would mistakenly reboot such
instances when we restart nova-compute service or on host boot. This
patch fixes this by adding NOSTATE into ignored_states.

Bug 1176897

Change-Id: I651cb043d7f97fde29b2a62e6ead8222062f01f7
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: ignore NOSTATE in resume_state_on_host_boot() method.

Occasionally, libvirt would get NOSTATE from hypervisor as instance
state. Thus if we don't ignore instances in NOSTATE in
resume_state_on_host_boot() method, we would mistakenly reboot such
instances when we restart nova-compute service or on host boot. This
patch fixes this by adding NOSTATE into ignored_states.

Bug 1176897

Change-Id: I651cb043d7f97fde29b2a62e6ead8222062f01f7

and which is not, it is necessary to figure out what

Change-Id: I3ffb529b611bd7ecd6c73a46786500d99dc2ed91

commit_message:
List Available APIs

To detect which API is tested in integration tests
and which is not, it is necessary to figure out what
kinds of APIs are implemented.
This adds an API to get a list of available Nova APIs.
The list would be compared with integration test data
like test logs.

The API returns
 *Method
 *URL path
 *Action
 *Brief outline
of each API.

Implements: blueprint list-tested-apis

Change-Id: I3ffb529b611bd7ecd6c73a46786500d99dc2ed91

subject: alarm: fix MongoDB alarm id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-07 12:10:19.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/impl_mongodb.py'], 'message': "alarm: fix MongoDB alarm id

The current implementation actually fails unit test because it tries to
use alarm id as the internal MongoDB object ID. That doesn't work
because MongoDB object ID must have a certain format and length.

Rather than using a backend specific alarm id, let's just use an uuid
based one that is not tight to the back-end.

Change-Id: I9ea79fc56b8beaf1efceddeaa5e9e43b620e5e98
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
"}]
commit_message:
alarm: fix MongoDB alarm id

The current implementation actually fails unit test because it tries to
use alarm id as the internal MongoDB object ID. That doesn't work
because MongoDB object ID must have a certain format and length.

Rather than using a backend specific alarm id, let's just use an uuid
based one that is not tight to the back-end.

Change-Id: I9ea79fc56b8beaf1efceddeaa5e9e43b620e5e98
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Wait for any nova server status that makes sense

Nova may return some transient states based on operator actions that do
not mean a resource has failed. Rather than report these as unexpected,
wait on them just like BUILD.

Fixes bug #1140324

Change-Id: I757c073fb8a7da44f41e9a9cb9ae71dbc35d3c33

commit_message:
Add test to handle nova BUILD status on create

Other tests assume nova will return an ACTIVE server on create, which is
somewhat unlikely.

Fixes bug #1133580

commit_message:
Use scheduler for driving autoscaling task

For threads that drive autoscaling events, run them to completion using the
task scheduler, to abstract out the sleeping from the main code.

Change-Id: I9b21404a171d92d6edbc59d3099d3ee34f08e22d

subject: Add a wrappertask decorator
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-05-07 13:12:06.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_scheduler.py', 'heat/engine/scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Add a wrappertask decorator

It is common that we might want to create a task that is a light wrapper
around another task. This allows us to, for example, call some clean-up
function after a PollingTaskGroup has completed. We really want to make
sure that any exceptions caused by timeout or cancellation get passed on to
the subtask as well.

Python 3 sports the "yield from" keyword (PEP 380) that effectively allows
the sort of nesting of generators that we want to do here. This change
provides a decorator function that allows the decorated generator function
to do the same thing using the "yield" keyword, even in Python 2.

Change-Id: I110141f2891ed35b8ffe98ec6ae8b42738f7db64
'}]
commit_message:
Add a wrappertask decorator

It is common that we might want to create a task that is a light wrapper
around another task. This allows us to, for example, call some clean-up
function after a PollingTaskGroup has completed. We really want to make
sure that any exceptions caused by timeout or cancellation get passed on to
the subtask as well.

Python 3 sports the "yield from" keyword (PEP 380) that effectively allows
the sort of nesting of generators that we want to do here. This change
provides a decorator function that allows the decorated generator function
to do the same thing using the "yield" keyword, even in Python 2.

Change-Id: I110141f2891ed35b8ffe98ec6ae8b42738f7db64

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-05-06 19:42:34.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/auth_password.py', 'etc/heat/heat-api.conf', 'heat/tests/test_auth_password.py', 'etc/heat/api-paste.ini'], 'message': 'Support password authentication.

Add alternative authentication middleware to authenticate against Keystone using
username and password instead of validating existing auth token. The benefit
being that you no longer require admin/service token to authenticate users.

To use, update heat-api.conf:
     [paste_deploy]
     flavor = standalone

This should make it possible to try heat out against existing public
clouds.

Change-Id: Ia584bba78e8984581f0fb6882bbb17d5efa238db
'}]
commit_message:
Support password authentication.

Add alternative authentication middleware to authenticate against Keystone using
username and password instead of validating existing auth token. The benefit
being that you no longer require admin/service token to authenticate users.

To use, update heat-api.conf:
     [paste_deploy]
     flavor = standalone

This should make it possible to try heat out against existing public
clouds.

Change-Id: Ia584bba78e8984581f0fb6882bbb17d5efa238db

subject: Fixed issue with use of delimiter in container queries.
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-05-07 18:33:42.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/db.py', 'test/unit/common/test_db.py'], 'message': "Fixed issue with use of delimiter in container queries.

Currently if you have a container with objects named
x/y and x0 and you use delimiter=/ in your query, x0
will be excluded from the results. This patch resolves
this problem.

To replicate the original issue, create a container
called 'test' with the following objects:

x/y
x0
x1

Then do a GET with 'accnt/test?delimiter=/' and the
following is returned:

x/
x1

i.e. x0 is missing from output.

Change-Id: If196e3075612b121ef8da4a9128167d00a248c27
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed issue with use of delimiter in container queries.

Currently if you have a container with objects named
x/y and x0 and you use delimiter=/ in your query, x0
will be excluded from the results. This patch resolves
this problem.

To replicate the original issue, create a container
called 'test' with the following objects:

x/y
x0
x1

Then do a GET with 'accnt/test?delimiter=/' and the
following is returned:

x/
x1

i.e. x0 is missing from output.

Change-Id: If196e3075612b121ef8da4a9128167d00a248c27

commit_message:
Fix cosmetic bug when displaying unnamed volumes

When displaying a selection of volumes while creating an instance,
volumes with no assigned name were being displayed improperly due
to lazy translation.

Change-Id: Ia89813ad7adbdabc7deba9075d3884837d4e8f75
Fixes: bug #1133174

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-03 21:33:33.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'message': "Add parsing to extra-specs key check

When using the filter scheduler which is now the default,
we can no longer pass in extra-specs like: {minIOPS:500, ....},
because the capabilities filter will reject this because there is
no host reporting minIOPS:500 capabilities.

We now need to scope the keys (ie qos:minIOPS:500....), but
that unfortunately requires a fix to the SolidFire driver.

This change add a check for the ':' in the key, and parses
on it if it's there.

Also fixes backend_name and uses VERSION var instead of
generating string in stats reporting.

Fixes bug: 1167141

Change-Id: Ie7fd7d231af78cb18a13f44a4379b44d3c3385df
(cherry picked from commit 0e3ea4e85dab00b7cecd5596f6daa65cc4d710b5)
"}]
commit_message:
Add parsing to extra-specs key check

When using the filter scheduler which is now the default,
we can no longer pass in extra-specs like: {minIOPS:500, ....},
because the capabilities filter will reject this because there is
no host reporting minIOPS:500 capabilities.

We now need to scope the keys (ie qos:minIOPS:500....), but
that unfortunately requires a fix to the SolidFire driver.

This change add a check for the ':' in the key, and parses
on it if it's there.

Also fixes backend_name and uses VERSION var instead of
generating string in stats reporting.

Fixes bug: 1167141

Change-Id: Ie7fd7d231af78cb18a13f44a4379b44d3c3385df
(cherry picked from commit 0e3ea4e85dab00b7cecd5596f6daa65cc4d710b5)

subject: Skip IPv6 tests for eventlet dns
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-07 16:14:23.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/test.py'], 'message': 'Skip IPv6 tests for eventlet dns

Eventlet address resolving doesn't support IPv6. This is causing the
gate to fail.

The failure happens when the dnspython package is installed in the
environment. When dnspython is there then eventlet takes over
getaddrinfo, and eventlet's getaddrinfo doesn't support IPv6. If
dnspython isn't there, then the eventlet patching doesn't happen
and IPv6 address resolution works.

It appears that the pip dependencies have recently been updated
so that dnspython gets installed now.

The fix is to skip the 3 tests that force the server to listen
on "::1".

Fixes bug 1176204

Once eventlet is updated, we can add the tests back in. Here's the
eventlet code in question:

https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/src/e0f578180d7d82d2ed3d8a96d520103503c524ec/eventlet/support/greendns.py?at=0.12#cl-166

Change-Id: Ib7a5a5f0dcac82229b7b7fb3df4b1ef141586c5f
'}]
commit_message:
Skip IPv6 tests for eventlet dns

Eventlet address resolving doesn't support IPv6. This is causing the
gate to fail.

The failure happens when the dnspython package is installed in the
environment. When dnspython is there then eventlet takes over
getaddrinfo, and eventlet's getaddrinfo doesn't support IPv6. If
dnspython isn't there, then the eventlet patching doesn't happen
and IPv6 address resolution works.

It appears that the pip dependencies have recently been updated
so that dnspython gets installed now.

The fix is to skip the 3 tests that force the server to listen
on "::1".

Fixes bug 1176204

Once eventlet is updated, we can add the tests back in. Here's the
eventlet code in question:

https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/src/e0f578180d7d82d2ed3d8a96d520103503c524ec/eventlet/support/greendns.py?at=0.12#cl-166

Change-Id: Ib7a5a5f0dcac82229b7b7fb3df4b1ef141586c5f

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-05-03 19:31:57.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/ldap/core.py'], 'message': "LDAP list groups with missing member entry

Using the LDAP identity backend,
if a group member entry doesn't exist in the LDAP server anymore
and the group's members are listed using GET /v3/groups/{groupId}/users,
Keystone returns 404 Not Found.

The server should return all the group members that do exist
and ignore the missing members,
and probably log a warning message about the missing user.

Fixes bug 1174585

Change-Id: Idf7c8c7f87affc4a72c5fe5e18e09a0f362e2646
"}]
commit_message:
LDAP list groups with missing member entry

Using the LDAP identity backend,
if a group member entry doesn't exist in the LDAP server anymore
and the group's members are listed using GET /v3/groups/{groupId}/users,
Keystone returns 404 Not Found.

The server should return all the group members that do exist
and ignore the missing members,
and probably log a warning message about the missing user.

Fixes bug 1174585

Change-Id: Idf7c8c7f87affc4a72c5fe5e18e09a0f362e2646

commit_message:
Fix ability to add custom volume_backend_name

This patch fixes the ability to set the volume_backend_name
for each driver.   The original bug was filed against LeftHand
and 3PAR, but several drivers exhibited a fixed backend name.

Fixes: bug #1175222
       bug #1172286

Change-Id: I4197f99bebd6ca8e4969795ae6edb537bc066c90

subject: change test_register_http_image to use explicit url
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-05-06 22:39:30.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/image/v1/test_images.py', 'etc/tempest.conf.sample', 'tempest/config.py'], 'message': "change test_register_http_image to use explicit url

previously test_register_http_image did some black magic with
sending an image into swift then using swift as an http server
for the purposes of this test. However there is no other requirement
in this test that swift is actually running, so it breaks under
a default devstack env (and possibly other enviroments).

The real test is whether an http image can be pulled into glance.
Use the cirros image as a default, but allow people to specify
another value if they don't have internet access.

attempt to fix pep8

Change-Id: I3800f4bf7174b85aab747f0c7fe911acac033383
"}]
commit_message:
change test_register_http_image to use explicit url

previously test_register_http_image did some black magic with
sending an image into swift then using swift as an http server
for the purposes of this test. However there is no other requirement
in this test that swift is actually running, so it breaks under
a default devstack env (and possibly other enviroments).

The real test is whether an http image can be pulled into glance.
Use the cirros image as a default, but allow people to specify
another value if they don't have internet access.

attempt to fix pep8

Change-Id: I3800f4bf7174b85aab747f0c7fe911acac033383

commit_message:
improve VMware Nova docs, including most new grizzly items.

bug #1106404
bug #1100147

The existing VMware Nova docs were very outdated, incomplete,
and in a few cases, just plan wrong.  They also did not cover the new
VMwareVCDriver and associated updates that arrived in Grizzly.  This
commit removes a lot of stale content (and even graphics) and adds the
basic instructions for both the VMwareVCDriver and the VMwareESXDriver.

I filed an additional bug for some topics (disk details, vnc) that
I did not already cover (bug #1175000)

Change-Id: Id6a4c9022e07f82622aa40eedd0449956f0475e8

subject: Only use tmpfs if build machine has 4GB+ RAM.
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-05-07 15:39:36.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create', 'lib/img-defaults', 'lib/ramdisk-functions', 'lib/img-functions', 'lib/common-functions', 'lib/ramdisk-defaults', 'README.md', 'sudoers.d/img-build-sudoers'], 'message': 'Only use tmpfs if build machine has 4GB+ RAM.

For machines with low RAM (or no access to /proc/meminfo) the builder
will still run, but will just build inside the filesystem that is
hosting /tmp. This will result in a slower build (especially if there
are a lot of .deb packages installed).

Fixes bug #1175453

Change-Id: I79f2672058c11e377548820df0ab4fad8f47ffdc
'}]
commit_message:
Only use tmpfs if build machine has 4GB+ RAM.

For machines with low RAM (or no access to /proc/meminfo) the builder
will still run, but will just build inside the filesystem that is
hosting /tmp. This will result in a slower build (especially if there
are a lot of .deb packages installed).

Fixes bug #1175453

Change-Id: I79f2672058c11e377548820df0ab4fad8f47ffdc

commit_message:
Fix *-paste.ini to use keystoneclient.

We do not want glance to need all of keystone, just the version of this
middleware that is included in keystoneclient, which will be pulled in
by the pip requires of glance.

Change-Id: I4cef706a7c8f260454863205b7824daac867848d

commit_message:
Log msg for load policy file only if the file is actually loaded

The Load entry was previousy in init(), whereas it should have
been in _set_rules() which is invoked only when policies are
(re)loaded from the json file.

Change-Id: Ib4ce66569a64fc4be8f5f77d7f503cc93ac0006e
