subject: update-port error if port does not exist in nvp
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 261, 'name': 'Salvatore Orlando', 'email': 'salv.orlando@gmail.com', 'username': 'salvatore-orlando'}, {'_account_id': 447, 'name': 'dan wendlandt', 'email': 'dan@nicira.com', 'username': 'danwent'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 5127, 'name': 'Justin Hammond', 'email': 'runningempty@gmail.com', 'username': 'justin-hammond'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-05-07 15:25:01.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/plugins/nicira/QuantumPlugin.py'], 'message': 'update-port error if port does not exist in nvp

Previously the NVP plugin would query NVP for the quantum port id that was
stored in the port as a tag in NVP. Later, a look up table was added in order
to directly look up the ID without having to go to NVP. The problem that can
arise is that if a port was created in folsom before this lookup table was
added and then deleted from NVP directly an error will be raised when calling
update_port(). This patch fixes this potential problem.

Fixes bug 1172006

Change-Id: I08c74e305449f7fe32897abf43ceb430c959b02d
'}]
commit_message:
update-port error if port does not exist in nvp

Previously the NVP plugin would query NVP for the quantum port id that was
stored in the port as a tag in NVP. Later, a look up table was added in order
to directly look up the ID without having to go to NVP. The problem that can
arise is that if a port was created in folsom before this lookup table was
added and then deleted from NVP directly an error will be raised when calling
update_port(). This patch fixes this potential problem.

Fixes bug 1172006

Change-Id: I08c74e305449f7fe32897abf43ceb430c959b02d

When the VM is in SHUTOFF status and the original compute host is
down, issue the "nova evacuate" command to rebuild the VM on

must be integers.

Fix bug 1176773
Change-Id: I76ebce6882198365717167f29a484e4ec994db0c
'}]
commit_message:
Nova evacuate failed when VM is in SHUTOFF status

When the VM is in SHUTOFF status and the original compute host is
down, issue the "nova evacuate" command to rebuild the VM on
another host, it is failed due to a type error: string indices
must be integers.

Fix bug 1176773
Change-Id: I76ebce6882198365717167f29a484e4ec994db0c

commit_message:
Change format of some judgments

Because "not volume" will be True if volume id is 0.It can not
distinguish 0 from None.The same to some other judgments where
variable value may be 0.

This patch also does the following changes:
Deletes check storagepool in function _check_conf_file and adds
check default iscsi target IP in function initialize_connection.
Moves create host group from do_setup to initialize_connection.
Changes _get_login_info to be _update_login_info.

Also fixes some formatting issues in log messages that are
fixed in master.

Fixes bug: 1160340
Change-Id: I0434b587d57c783f10d5724c4c66aea5df0b32e5
(cherry picked from commit a3848ed80d7306833a87b1f7cfa3f89b58ab744a)

commit_message:
style: Fix flake8 and hacking errors

In the interest of conforming to the de-facto coding standard for
OpenStack projects, this patch enables all checks for flake8 and
hacking, plus fixes everything reported.

Also, several docstrings were edited for clarity and grammar.

Change-Id: If85c4e420811b6df8eb55de1b5f07a0a8acfceff
Implements: blueprint grizzly-debt

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-07 05:58:04.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'nova/network/sg.py', 'nova/network/manager.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_security_group_default_rules.py', 'nova/network/security_group/openstack_driver.py', 'nova/network/quantumv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/network/test_manager.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Remove security_group_handler

Now that nova's security groups are more plugable and decoupled from the
database the security_group_handler code is not very useful so this patch
removes it.

A little info about the security_group_handler:
The security_group_handle code was added to provide a hook into nova security
groups so that one could get security group add/delete/update notification
and proxy them somewhere else (i.e quantum). Trying to actually using this
method opens one up to several transactional issues because in the current
implemenation the security group is commited to the nova database before
security_group_handler is called.

Implements blueprint: remove-security-group-handler

Change-Id: I45047fe8dbb81555505e03309838910113080c37
"}]
commit_message:
Remove security_group_handler

Now that nova's security groups are more plugable and decoupled from the
database the security_group_handler code is not very useful so this patch
removes it.

A little info about the security_group_handler:
The security_group_handle code was added to provide a hook into nova security
groups so that one could get security group add/delete/update notification
and proxy them somewhere else (i.e quantum). Trying to actually using this
method opens one up to several transactional issues because in the current
implemenation the security group is commited to the nova database before
security_group_handler is called.

Implements blueprint: remove-security-group-handler

Change-Id: I45047fe8dbb81555505e03309838910113080c37

subject: Fix 500 raised on disassociate_floatingips when out of sync
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-05-07 13:28:46.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/plugins/nicira/QuantumPlugin.py'], 'message': 'Fix 500 raised on disassociate_floatingips when out of sync

If one deletes NAT rules directly from NVP and not through quantum,
an error will be raised when deleting a port that is associated with
the floating ip. This patch catches the NotFound exception and logs
it so that the port can successfully be deleted.

Fixes bug: 1177176

Change-Id: Ia7d0b94957d0c6b014d242439245b0e4fa9de40d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix 500 raised on disassociate_floatingips when out of sync

If one deletes NAT rules directly from NVP and not through quantum,
an error will be raised when deleting a port that is associated with
the floating ip. This patch catches the NotFound exception and logs
it so that the port can successfully be deleted.

Fixes bug: 1177176

Change-Id: Ia7d0b94957d0c6b014d242439245b0e4fa9de40d

subject: Convert unicode for python3 portability
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-05-06 20:52:50.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/policy.py', 'openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py', 'openstack/common/rpc/common.py', 'tests/unit/rpc/test_common.py', 'tests/unit/rpc/test_proxy.py', 'tools/pip-requires', 'tests/unit/rpc/test_kombu.py', 'openstack/common/jsonutils.py', 'openstack/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Convert unicode for python3 portability

From http://docs.python.org/3.1/whatsnew/3.0.html:

"Python 3.0 uses the concepts of text and (binary) data instead of
Unicode strings and 8-bit strings."

Use six.text_type to Type for representing (Unicode) textual data. This
is unicode() in Python 2 and str in Python 3.

Change-Id: I3da268a714a34a8e626a2590f01b86e414dc3411
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Convert unicode for python3 portability

From http://docs.python.org/3.1/whatsnew/3.0.html:

"Python 3.0 uses the concepts of text and (binary) data instead of
Unicode strings and 8-bit strings."

Use six.text_type to Type for representing (Unicode) textual data. This
is unicode() in Python 2 and str in Python 3.

Change-Id: I3da268a714a34a8e626a2590f01b86e414dc3411
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Re-work test_cli to use testscenarios.

The cli tests were already organized in a manner that lets testscenarios
do what it does. Reformat the code a little bit to be a single test plus
a list of declarative combinations of scenarios and let testscenarios
do the work of turning that into a set of test cases.

Change-Id: I4e10d9eaeb313c724f0012babac465e37be4fa3d

revisions:
[{'number': 22, 'created': '2013-05-06 14:01:51.000000000', 'files': ['etc/tempest.conf.sample', 'tempest/config.py', 'tempest/tests/volume/admin/test_multi_backend.py'], 'message': 'Adds Cinder Multi-Backend Test

Adds a new file containing 1 test:
- test if the multi backend feature is working: "os-vol-attr:host"
  should return something like: "host@backend_name"
- test if the creation of a volume with a specific volume type is
  created in the good backend

2 backend (configured in cinder.conf) are required to work properly.
This patch introduces new tempest configuration variables:
- multi_backend_enabled: skip the tests if it's set to false
- backend1_name: name of the first backend
- backend2_name: name of a second backend
(backend1_name and backend2_name must be different)

Change-Id: I82d533e0737ffde54b3829f2a8b91c75641f2639
'}]
commit_message:
Adds Cinder Multi-Backend Test

Adds a new file containing 1 test:
- test if the multi backend feature is working: "os-vol-attr:host"
  should return something like: "host@backend_name"
- test if the creation of a volume with a specific volume type is
  created in the good backend

2 backend (configured in cinder.conf) are required to work properly.
This patch introduces new tempest configuration variables:
- multi_backend_enabled: skip the tests if it's set to false
- backend1_name: name of the first backend
- backend2_name: name of a second backend
(backend1_name and backend2_name must be different)

Change-Id: I82d533e0737ffde54b3829f2a8b91c75641f2639

subject: Add GroupEvenSpreadWeigher for nova scheduler
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-07 11:23:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/weights/group_weigher.py', 'doc/source/devref/filter_scheduler.rst', 'nova/tests/scheduler/test_weights.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': 'Add GroupEvenSpreadWeigher for nova scheduler

GroupEvenSpreadWeigher allows to spread instances from definite

'}]
commit_message:
Add GroupEvenSpreadWeigher for nova scheduler

GroupEvenSpreadWeigher allows to spread instances from definite
group between all accessible hosts. It is necessary to pass a
scheduler hint, using group as key and name of the group as value,
when booting an instance.

Add tests for this weigher.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ieca90f9bf4a84159724ff5479131b53af8d34eed

commit_message:
Support Snapshot policy in volumes

This handles the Snapshot DeletionPolicy in the AWS::EC2::Volume
resource, creating a backup of the volume before deleting it. It
requires a recent cinder client with backup support.

Implements: blueprint volume-snapshots
Change-Id: Idbb14a434ad6ccde9f198e07799e8aef0867dd6f

commit_message:
Delete InstanceSystemMetadata on instance deletion

Thanks to no-db-compute only pre-delete instance data is used in
notifications. So now we can go back to deleting InstanceSystemMetadata
when an instance is deleted.

Fixes bug 1153827

Change-Id: Ic66b998cde2a15a24f302f08c34753a8b57da73d

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2013-05-06 23:01:06.000000000', 'files': ['glance/registry/api/v2/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v1/test_registry_api.py', 'glance/common/exception.py', 'glance/common/wsgi.py', 'glance/common/rpc.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/registry/api/v2/rpc.py', 'glance/tests/unit/common/test_rpc.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_registry_api.py'], 'message': "Implement registry API v2

This patch implements registry's API v2 based on the blueprint
registry-api-v2.

Major changes:
    * The new registry API is implemented using a small rpc protocol
      over http. Resources must be registered and the exposed methods
      will be automatically discovered (they must start with rpc_).

        consistency with v2 unit)
    * Added test_registry to unit/v2/

Implements blueprint registry-api-v2

Change-Id: Ia9f6eb60f52bb093e807a8a89d4df89fb80c4336
"}]
commit_message:
Implement registry API v2

This patch implements registry's API v2 based on the blueprint
registry-api-v2.

Major changes:
    * The new registry API is implemented using a small rpc protocol
      over http. Resources must be registered and the exposed methods
      will be automatically discovered (they must start with rpc_).
    * Registry's API now returns data as returned by the db-api. The
      idea behind this is to provide a db-like api that can be used as a
      db-driver leaving to glance-api the responsibility for cleaning
      up what will go out to the client.

Minor changes:
    * Split unit/v1/test_api.py in 2 separate test files (for
        consistency with v2 unit)
    * Added test_registry to unit/v2/

Implements blueprint registry-api-v2

Change-Id: Ia9f6eb60f52bb093e807a8a89d4df89fb80c4336

subject: Restore compatibility with PrettyTable 0.7.2 update
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-04-29 11:40:10.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/utils.py', 'tests/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Restore compatibility with PrettyTable 0.7.2 update

This reverts commit 69f9971da54b46a8883148e4cef6346c7933b6ec

PrettyTable 0.7.2 defaults to print a table even if
the resultset is empty, which breaks the unit test and
also backward compatibilty. Restore previous behavior
to be in line with older prettytable releases.

Fixes bug 1166464

Change-Id: Ifaf5a91cefab1e85a35c5371793331c6bf83def4
'}]
commit_message:
Restore compatibility with PrettyTable 0.7.2 update

This reverts commit 69f9971da54b46a8883148e4cef6346c7933b6ec

PrettyTable 0.7.2 defaults to print a table even if
the resultset is empty, which breaks the unit test and
also backward compatibilty. Restore previous behavior
to be in line with older prettytable releases.

Fixes bug 1166464

Change-Id: Ifaf5a91cefab1e85a35c5371793331c6bf83def4

subject: Skip IPv6 tests for eventlet dns
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 494, 'name': 'termie', 'email': 'termie@openstack.org', 'username': 'termie'}, {'_account_id': 1916, 'name': 'Guang Yee', 'email': 'gyee@suse.com', 'username': 'guang-yee'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5280, 'name': 'Nicolas Simonds', 'email': 'nic@metacloud.com', 'username': 'nicolas.simonds'}, {'_account_id': 5707, 'name': 'henry-nash', 'email': 'henry.nash@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'henry-nash'}, {'_account_id': 6460, 'name': 'Brad Topol', 'email': 'btopol@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'btopol'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-05-07 02:23:57.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/test.py'], 'message': 'Skip IPv6 tests for eventlet dns

Eventlet address resolving doesn't support IPv6. This is causing the
gate to fail.

The failure happens when the dnspython package is installed in the
environment. When dnspython is there then eventlet takes over
getaddrinfo, and eventlet's getaddrinfo doesn't support IPv6. If
dnspython isn't there, then the eventlet patching doesn't happen
and IPv6 address resolution works.

It appears that the pip dependencies have recently been updated
so that dnspython gets installed now.

The fix is to skip the 3 tests that force the server to listen
on "::1".

Fixes bug 1176204

Once eventlet is updated, we can add the tests back in. Here's the
eventlet code in question:

https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/src/e0f578180d7d82d2ed3d8a96d520103503c524ec/eventlet/support/greendns.py?at=0.12#cl-166

Change-Id: Ib7a5a5f0dcac82229b7b7fb3df4b1ef141586c5f
'}]
commit_message:
Skip IPv6 tests for eventlet dns

Eventlet address resolving doesn't support IPv6. This is causing the
gate to fail.

The failure happens when the dnspython package is installed in the
environment. When dnspython is there then eventlet takes over
getaddrinfo, and eventlet's getaddrinfo doesn't support IPv6. If
dnspython isn't there, then the eventlet patching doesn't happen
and IPv6 address resolution works.

It appears that the pip dependencies have recently been updated
so that dnspython gets installed now.

The fix is to skip the 3 tests that force the server to listen
on "::1".

Fixes bug 1176204

Once eventlet is updated, we can add the tests back in. Here's the
eventlet code in question:

https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/src/e0f578180d7d82d2ed3d8a96d520103503c524ec/eventlet/support/greendns.py?at=0.12#cl-166

Change-Id: Ib7a5a5f0dcac82229b7b7fb3df4b1ef141586c5f

subject: Make sure heatclient shows body of errors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-07 02:39:16.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/exc.py'], 'message': 'Make sure heatclient shows body of errors

Previously the code tried to iterate over the response from the
server twice, leading to an empty error message being shown to the
user, or a nasty backtrace since the code expected a full string.

Fixes bug #1177163

Change-Id: If6c2e9b5a010198d70a5a84611c63b4e4d265fe4
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure heatclient shows body of errors

Previously the code tried to iterate over the response from the
server twice, leading to an empty error message being shown to the
user, or a nasty backtrace since the code expected a full string.

Fixes bug #1177163

Change-Id: If6c2e9b5a010198d70a5a84611c63b4e4d265fe4
